programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Blackpool compete to win the £1,000 prize, including former dancer Rowan and businessman John, who start the proceedings. Also vying to win are Sally and Joanne who hope to impress their guests with an unusual menu that features a Tandoori Tower and a belly-busting breakfast, before competitive duo Holly and Ollie pull out all the stops in an attempt to secure the cash.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals that owners Lynette and David want big money for. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry from Cashbrokers in Penzance goes to look at some antique petrol pumps, while in south-east London childhood sweethearts want to pawn their jewellery to fund a family reunion.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer travel to Aberdeen, where they give expert advice to newlyweds who are looking for a spacious city-centre home, and a couple willing to leave the hustle and bustle behind to find a rural retreat.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps two sets of house hunters in Staffordshire and Warwickshire, looking to find both the buzz of the city and the peace of the country.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Julie and James host at the Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, where the guests are impressed by their rooms, but once again luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime want more from their beds.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Natasha Conti hosts the first dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and puts together an evening on the theme of a summer fete, complete with prizes for her fellow competitors. However, as the guests get to know each other, Chris Hiller finds himself in an awkward situation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm manager Sophie McConnell hopes that her pig-racing entertainment will impress the guests on her night as host in Salisbury, Wiltshire. She also plans to serve her home-raised cow Levi for the main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Brown-Hovelt hosts the third dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and his menu includes Uzbekistani food and porridge ice-cream. The former army major dresses as an American sailor, but Natasha Conti does not find the outfit as appealing as she had hoped.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housing support officer Chris Hiller plans an eclectic but affordable menu for his night in Salisbury, Wiltshire, including chicken a l'orange and peppers stuffed with baked beans. However, with the sole focus being on keeping costs low, his efforts might not go down well with the other guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Care worker Jane Arnold hosts the final dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, hoping to impress her guests with food from her local area. However, it is her bedroom revelations that catch the diners' attentions, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Find Me a Home
programme.desc: Phil tries to help two families who have been made homeless, but is shocked by the terrible housing conditions so many people are forced to endure. Corvel and Meyrem are a hard-working couple from Southwark in London, who are being evicted from their one-bedroom cockroach and rat-infested flat, while Bibi and her 15-year-old son Oscar were evicted from the home they'd lived in for 15 years and have hit a brick wall when it comes to finding a new place.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides Joel Dommett, Jermaine Jenas, Adil Ray, Tamara Wall and team captain Rylan Clark-Neal on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team members must conquer physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Nahida from Liverpool is searching for a man who shares her passion for food, and her date is with fellow Liverpudlian Thomas, who describes himself as a loveable bear. Ex-cruise ship worker Dale, 46, has been single for five years since his partner passed away, but is now ready to put his faith in Cupid again, and his date is 39-year-old massage therapist Chris.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Diners include Sherry, a 65-year-old dominatrix looking for romance. She hopes chartered surveyor and t'ai chi enthusiast John might be the man for her. Meanwhile, Hannah, 40, is looking for a man who shares her love of adventure. Could 42-year-old Christmas tree farmer Rob be her Mr Right?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Icebergs explode into thousands of pieces in Antarctica, locals film a rare snowstorm in the Saudi Arabian desert, and more than 10,000 seabirds are killed off the north-west coast of America when storms churn up algae in the waters, creating deadly sea foam. In Canada, tourists witness a full-circle rainbow, and a firefighter in Texas is caught up in a wave of hail so large that it shuts down the highway.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a Kent couple who want to downsize and move closer to London, and a couple who find their home in the commuter belt of Berkshire and Buckinghamshire too remote.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Blackpool compete for the £1,000 prize, beginning with practising Buddhist Antonio and former redcoat Jason, who serve up a sushi starter. A discovery on day two at the home of fireman Daz and his wife Kim raises a few eyebrows, while the final night sees foodies Martin and Kate prepare an authentic Thai menu and a chocolate dessert.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Penzance, Larry Kohen and Neil McLaughlin at Cashbrokers pawnbrokers go out to sea to test-drive a jet ski. Meanwhile, Lee has Crufts memorabilia he wants to sell, Dan and his team consider a houseboat, and a Picasso is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Nathan and Debb test-drive an unusual motorcycle simulator at Pickwick Pawnbrokers, while Larry and Neil look to complete deals involving a rare drum kit, a luxury set of travel bags and an antique medicine cabinet at Cashbrokers in Penzance.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help house-hunters in Oxfordshire, beginning with military couple Chris and Nikki, who have their hearts set on a rural home with plenty of potential to renovate. The property experts also come to the aid of Richard and Jane, who wish to move their large family into more suitable accommodation. Despite a budget of £500,000, the task seems impossible to achieve because of their extensive list of requirements.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a Kent couple who want to downsize and move closer to London, and a couple who find their home in the commuter belt of Berkshire and Buckinghamshire too remote.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery, where the high level of finish in the rooms surprises all of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Virginia Houslin opens the contest in Huddersfield, and her hopes for some flirtatious fun are boosted by the arrival of her first guest, wedding singer Richard Wood. However the cheeky host faces a battle to win over the taste buds of her other diners as she tries to stake her claim for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business development manager Iyesha Atkins hosts the second dinner party in Huddersfield, hoping her sophisticated event will win her the £1,000 prize. However, the evening does not go to plan when Virginia finds fault with Iyesha's main course, and the two women fall out following a discussion about religion.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding singer and confident cook Richard Wood hosts the third dinner party in Huddersfield. With steak on the menu, he opts not to listen to his guests' preferences and instead cooks and serves them his own way. However, with the starter a disaster and the rift between mum-of-three Virginia and ladette Iyesha deepening, Richard believes the only solution to save his night is for him to sing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tommy Mack hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, and tries to woo his guests with a Hollywood silent movie-themed evening, which includes a selection of mystery dishes and his very own style of rapping.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kim Connor hosts the final party in Huddersfield, hoping her American diner-themed menu will delight her guests. Sweating over a hot stove is not what the glamorous hairdresser is used to, and she relies on helpful advice from her mother. The food fails to appeal to everyone's tastes, but Kim's after-dinner entertainment seems to revive her flagging chances of success.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzio's two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of China's Forbidden City
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Beijing palace that housed Chinese emperors for 600 years. The programme reveals the current conservation work being carried out and uncovers new details about past rulers, including trade with Europe and how a marble staircase was transported along an ice road. A scale model is used to demonstrate how the structure was built to withstand earthquakes.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: A wrestling match brings out the worst in the guys. Nostalgic comedy, guest starring Dwayne Johnson as his own father Rocky Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Penelope
programme.desc: An heiress is born with the nose of a pig due to a curse on her family - an enchantment that can only be lifted by finding a man who loves her. As she reaches adulthood, her story piques the interest of a tabloid reporter, who, determined to get a photograph of her nose, hires a down-on-his-luck gambler for the task. However, the desperate hack fails to count on romance getting in the way. Romantic fantasy, starring Christina Ricci, James McAvoy and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.desc: SpongeBob hears that a ferocious biker gang is coming to town, only no one seems bothered. So SpongeBob prepares to protect the town himself.(n)

programme.title: The Butcher Surgeon: Why Wasn't He Stopped
programme.desc: Documentary profiling former breast surgeon Ian Paterson, who was recently convicted of intentionally wounding patients by performing needless operations for more than a decade. Paterson was found guilty on 17 counts, and this programme examines how was he able to continue for so long, asking whether his employers might have ignored or failed to act on a series of warnings stretching back to 2003. Some of Paterson's victims are also interviewed, along with health service whistleblowers.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: Aaron Roach Bridgeman explores court restrictions and anonymity orders placed on child murderers, meaning the media cannot name perpetrators until the age of 18.(n)

programme.title: Soham Revisited: 15 Years On
programme.desc: Documentary examining events that took place in the small Cambridgeshire town which horrified the country. In December 2003, Iain Huntley, a caretaker at Soham Village College, was convicted of two murders and jailed for life. This film looks at the search for his victims, Huntley's arrest, and his subsequent trial and conviction.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: I Should Have Never Gone Ziplining.
programme.desc: The boys eagerly anticipate spending a day ziplining in the Colorado Mountains. However, the trip takes a bad turn, and with no-one to turn to for help, their chances of surviving become slim.(n)

programme.desc: A new girl arrives at South Park Elementary, and everyone becomes preoccupied with finding out who she has a crush on. The occasion causes Cartman to discover something inside himself that he never knew he had, and he sets out to make sure nobody gets in the way of true love.(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: In November 1974, a family of six was brutally murdered. Now, a year later, an unsuspecting young couple, George and Kathy Lutz, and their children move into the house that was the site of the horrific event and is now haunted by a murderous presence. What follows is 28 days of unimaginable terror. With demonic visions of the dead and relentless screams of terror, this is the haunted house story that isn't just a movie - it's real(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: A widow poses as a nanny to seek revenge against a new mother, who does not know that their pasts are intertwined(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: John Moore's remake of the 1965 classic stars Dennis Quaid as a pilot who crash lands his passenger plane in the Gobi desert with no hope of rescue - unless they can scavenge enough parts to build a new plane(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A down on his luck Polish actor with a straying wife makes a plan to get them both out of the country and escape the impending horrors of the Nazi invasion(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: In this tasty romantic drama, a cocky skirt-chasing bartender drops out of law school in search of a top-shelf lifestyle. Later, his romance with a pretty waitress is threatened by an alluring fashion executive who wants him all to herself(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Entertaining biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards, whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics marked the first time a Brit had ever competed at ski jumping. Edwards trains for the sport with a former champ, and finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: In this hip reboot of the comic-book franchise, a brilliant scientist builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: Will Ferrell, Woody Harrelson and André Benjamin star in Kent Alterman's sports comedy. Jackie Moon is a musician whose sole chart success earns him enough to buy a professional basketball team. It's 1976 and Moon's team, the Tropics, plays in the American Basketball Association, which is about to merge with the National Basketball Association. But only four teams from the ABA will survive the merger, and Moon is determined not to be left owning a defunct team. As well as earning enough points, they also have to attract at least 2000 fans to each home game, so Moon stages a series of desperate publicity stunts, from the astute to the gloriously insane (and, while this is a loose retelling of the ABA/NBA story, some of these stunts actually happened). Can Moon, his back-from-retirement signing Monix and self-centred but promising youngster Clarence ensure the Tropics' survival?(n)

programme.title: Casanova
programme.desc: History's most renowned ladies' man finally meets his match in this historical romance laced with comedy and adventure. In Venice in 1753, Giacomo Casanova (Heath Ledger) is a notorious playboy whose way with women goes too far when he's caught leaving the bedroom of a novice nun, and one of the leading prosecutors of the Inquisition, Pucci (Jeremy Irons), puts him on trial. The Doge (Tim McInnerny), Venice's political point man, is a friend of Casanova's and pulls strings to get him off the hook and allow him to stay in the city, but under one condition -- he must take a wife and remain faithful to her. Casanova sets his sights on Victoria (Natalie Dormer), a lovely young maiden who is obviously taken with the handsome ladykiller, but he's not the only one who wants her hand. Giovanni Bruni (Charlie Cox) is a young man who is very much in love with Victoria, and in order to move him out of the picture, Casanova challenges him to a duel. However, when Casanova is bested in swords in the challenge, he discovers he's actually been parrying with Giovanni's sister, Francesca (Sienna Miller). As Casanova gets to know Francesca, he discovers she's a gifted writer and a bright and independent woman as well as a good hand with a sword, and he comes to the realization that she's the woman he wants to take to the altar. However, Francesca has already been promised to the vain and chubby Papprizzio (Oliver Platt), a man she's never met, and she doesn't seem at all interested in the notorious Casanova. Casanova also stars Lena Olin, and Omid Djalili(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer (Angelina Jolie-Pitt) and her writer husband (Brad Pitt) attempt to rebuild their crumbling marriage by taking an extended vacation to a small coastal town, where they bond with its quirky inhabitants. As he struggles with writer's block and she with her emotional turmoil stemming from their troubled relationship, they try to remember what brought them together fourteen years prior. This film marks the first time in ten years that Angelina Jolie-Pitt and Brad Pitt have starred together, since the 2005 film Mr. and Mrs. Smith. Jolie-Pitt is also the writer and director of the film(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote and directed this delightful romantic comedy, reminiscent of his Oscar winner, "Annie Hall." Jason Biggs stars as a hapless writer frustrated by his very appealing, very neurotic girlfriend (Christina Ricci). Allen also costars as Biggs' mentor. Danny DeVito, Stockard Channing, Fisher Stevens, David Conrad, Jimmy Fallon(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Searching for her kidnapped sister in the Colombian jungle, writer Kathleen Turner is not amused when rugged Michael Douglas lends an unwanted hand. Add a small dose of big-time baddie Danny DeVito for a knockabout action romance(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore pair up for this tuneful romcom. Waitress Julia and failed songwriter Robbie are engaged to be married. But unfortunately, not to one another(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: Peter is a composer and a likable sad sack who's devastated when his girlfriend of five years, Sarah Marshall, the star of a cheesy CSI-style crime show, dumps him. He weeps, he rails, he mopes. Finally, his step-brother Brian suggests Hawaii, so Peter heads for a resort on Oahu where, as he's checking in, he sees Sarah and her new beau, Aldous, a polymorphously perverse English rocker(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: In this smart, satrical comedy, a female political consultant is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival, who is working on the opponent's campaign and is looking for every opportunity to antagonize her(n)

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: When Jeff's girlfriend is abducted by a highly intelligent psychopath, his only hope of finding her is to put himself in the kidnapper's hands(n)

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Nick Pulovski is a cop, presently assigned to the auto theft division. When he discovers that a man named Strom is the brains behind a major car theft and chop shop ring, he sees this as his opportunity to do something big. After his partner is killed, the case is then transferred to homicide, so he is taken off the case. And he is assigned a new partner, a cop who would prefer to play by the rules(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: Hollywood filmmaker Donald Petrie directs the comedy Welcome to Mooseport. Gene Hackman stars as former U.S. President Monroe "The Eagle" Cole. He's retired to the small New England town of Mooseport, ME, in order to write his memoirs and relax. The retirement is put on hold, however, when he's persuaded to run for mayor of the town. Meanwhile, local hardware store owner and plumber Handy Harrison (Ray Romano) is just the sort of plaid-shirted everyman to run against him. Cole seems a sure win in the race, especially with his loyal personal assistants (Marcia Gay Harden and Fred Savage) aiding his every move. The competition gets even more severe when Handy's sweetheart Sally (Maura Tierney) comes between the two men. Welcome to Mooseport also stars Christine Baranski and Rip Torn(n)

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: Barry Levinson's masterly tribute to his youthful years in Baltimore is an early showcase for future stars; Kevin Bacon, Mickey Rourke and Ellen Barkin(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: (2002) Ben Affleck plays well-heeled lawyer Gavin Banek dashing to a meeting; while Samuel L Jackson takes the role of Doyle Gipson, an estranged husband on his way to a child custody hearing. When the pair's cars collide in a minor accident, Banek dashes off a cheque and leaves, little knowing he's accidentally taken a document crucial to Gipson's hearing that sees him lose the case. But Gipson has an equally vital document belonging to Banek and so begins a battle of wills and wits in Roger Michell's fast-moving thriller(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: Gene Hackman is Popeye Doyle, the New York detective whose implacable pursuit of French narcotics smuggler Alain Charnier (eternally urbane Fernando Rey) led to America's biggest heroin seizure. A breakneck action thriller with a core of Smith and Wesson steel(n)

programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: A respected relationship therapist is murdered, and the team's initial lead is a hotelier whose divorce-related file is missing from the office. When officers confront the man, they learn the victim traded the file for a no-questions, no-identity room, the safe of which is found to contain a large diamond. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A notorious drug dealer is murdered and suspicion falls on two possible culprits - a priest with a reputation as a vigilante, and the father of a teenager who died of an overdose. Briscoe and Green attempt to discover whether either of them took the law into his own hands. Starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A witness to a jewellery store robbery that went tragically wrong fails to appear in court. McCoy suspects foul play - until it transpires the man has been on the run for the past 20 years. Police drama, guest starring Mandy Patinkin of Criminal Minds fame, with Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nick and Riley investigate an attack on a skydiver who was critically injured when his parachute failed to open. Meanwhile, Catherine and Greg are called to a double murder and it seems the two cases share a surprising connection. Elsewhere, Langston struggles to solve the death of a religious fanatic in the desert as Brass questions the prime suspect, one of the victim's followers. George Eads stars.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.desc: A woman's life is left in tatters when her wealthy husband finds he has been conned out of millions by his best friend, and kills himself. Escaping the painful memories, she moves elsewhere and slowly begins to rebuild her life - until the conman hunts her down. Thriller, starring Peta Wilson.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a coastguard officer on board an abandoned cargo ship draws the team's attention to a family of Lebanese refugees hoping to find a new home in America. Meanwhile, Tony and McGee try to find the perfect woman for Gibbs. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Four murders occur in Manhattan, all of which seem to have been committed by the same sniper. Although the shootings appear random, Briscoe and Green suspect the deaths are linked and discover a connection between one of the victims and a former marine who is an expert shot with the rifle used in the crimes. Ty Burrell (Modern Family) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green have their hands full investigating four homicides, including the killing of a husband by his distraught wife and the murder of a woman who had a complex relationship with two brothers. They then have to look into the abduction of an expectant mother. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack spots the body of a young woman tied to a sunken boat while he is looking for a murder weapon in a pond in Central Park. The team traces a spot of blood on the ballgown she was wearing to a man she had previously dated, while a ripped-up cheque found near the scene of the crime sheds more light on the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. The victim is revealed to be Navy lieutenant Dean Massey, who DiNozzo Sr had threatened to kill after being cut out of a land development deal. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Briscoe and Green try to discover the identity of a masked youngster who opened fire on classmates, killing four and wounding several others. They soon learn more than one student fits the profile - and finding the perpetrator is given added urgency by the arrival of e-mails threatening more murders. Starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach, with a guest appearance by Carey Lowell.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Beck arrest a homeless man on suspicion of the rape and murder of a woman and her 10-year-old daughter - only to find he is actually Munch's estranged uncle Andrew (guest star Jerry Lewis). As the case proceeds, a new suspect is identified, but the evidence against him is thrown out in court - and events build to a tragic conclusion. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Connie Nielsen.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A rapist begins to escalate his crimes, attacking victims more than once - and Dr Huang suspects he has a particularly disturbing motive for targeting them. However, tensions flare between Stabler and Beck as they make a difficult decision to help catch whoever is responsible. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: New series. Lindsay is questioned by Commander Crowley, who has discovered that she and Voight were in the same location on the night of the killer's disappearance.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Calleigh's car is run off the road and into a canal while she is en route back to the lab - and although she is unhurt, vital evidence is compromised, jeopardising an investigation into a rogue biker gang. Realising the entire case is at risk, Horatio and the team try to find new leads to solve it. Forensic drama, starring Emily Procter and David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The body of a celebrity is found at a party and the team discovers links with a mysterious gambling ring offering participants the chance to bet on the dates of famous people's deaths. Further investigation leads the officers to an offshore operation producing high-quality counterfeit banjoes. The forensic spin-off show's 100th episode, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The team struggles to come to terms with the loss of a victim in a failed rescue operation at an apartment block. Meanwhile, Pete's colleagues are upset to learn of his fast-track promotion, local thugs terrorise the station, and a drug addict's behaviour puts Shay and Dawson's lives in danger during a call-out.(n)

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a luxury sports car dealer and identify a link between the victim's last customer and a recent spate of robberies. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: New York's district attorneys investigate the mysterious death of a stockbroker who was dating the daughter of a ruthless cosmetics mogul - and find themselves caught up in a wrangle over whether HRT withdrawal can be used as a defence in law. Police drama, guest starring Lucie Arnaz, with Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

The investigation soon highlights what can happen when a much-loved show is meddled with. Featuring cameos by the stars of genre shows, including Battlestar Galactica's Grace Park and Kate Vernon, and Babylon 5's Joshua Cox.(n)

Determined to face her fears, she visits the institution where her parent resides, and inadvertently triggers a series of terrifying events. Thriller, starring Kristy Swanson and David Keeley.(n)

Crime drama, guest starring Cheryl Ladd.(n)

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green question a comedian in connection with the death of his adopted child, and uncover allegations that he molested an 11-year-old boy years previously. Reopening the case, they investigate a tangled tale of greed, deceit and broken trust involving the alleged victim's parents. Starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate the death of war veteran Greg Tanner, whose body was discovered in a Hudson University car park. Clues lead the duo to law professor Kevin Franklin, a former employee of the Department of Justice, and the picture gets clearer as Franklin's memos from the Bush Administration are leaked as the case goes to court. The first episode in the final season of the crime drama, starring Jeremy Sisto, Anthony Anderson and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Ballerina Ellen White is found strangled at the Manhattan Conservatory of Dance, and Danny's analysis of the rope reveals traces of gunpowder manufactured before the American Civil War. Meanwhile, Lindsay is working on the case of a woman murdered in Hell's Kitchen and finds she was shot with a pre-Civil War revolver - providing a link between the two cases.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. After being stationed in Kabul, she became pregnant by a local man called Amir who was later killed in action - and Abby discovers he was the sole male heir of a wealthy family that owns a large tract of land in a politically sensitive part of Afghanistan.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander last seen in the company of a mysterious blonde woman, who turns out to be missing NCIS agent and Tony's ex-lover EJ Barrett. She identifies the murderer as Seal-turned-assassin Marcellus Dane, who is suspected of working for Casey Stratton - a member of black ops unit Phantom Eight. Guest starring Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: The cops search for a missing woman after a carjacking gone wrong, and are warned to tread carefully as it appears the white victim is being held in a predominantly black area.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Novak tries to track down Benson, whose testimony is vital to the successful outcome of a rape prosecution - but she is living under the assumed identity of a green activist and has infiltrated a group suspected of being eco-terrorists. Arrested during a confrontation with police, she is questioned over her fellow members' suspected involvement in a murder, and sets out to prove their innocence. Drama, starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A rag-tag group of con artists and ex-cons team up for the heist to end all heists in this high-profile remake of the 1960 Rat Pack favorite. As with its predecessor, Ocean's Eleven opens with its titular hero Danny Ocean (George Clooney stepping into the Frank Sinatra role) eager for a new challenge. The similarities to the original end there, as Ocean conspires with his old pal Rusty Ryan (Brad Pitt) to rob 150 million dollars from an underground vault that serves three of Las Vegas' biggest casinos. Between the two of them, they recruit nine other men, each with his own criminal specialty, to assist in the mission: moneyman Reuben Tishkoff (Elliot Gould), card dealer Frank (Bernie Mac), pickpocket Linus (Matt Damon), aging con artist Saul (Carl Reiner), British explosives pro Basher (Don Cheadle), techie Dell (Eddie Jemison), rude-boy brothers Virgil (Casey Affleck) and Turk (Scott Caan), and professional acrobat Yen (Shaobo Qin). What Ocean doesn't tell the group is that there's another reason he's coordinating the heist: the three casinos they're robbing are all owned by ruthless gambling mogul Terry Benedict (Andy Garcia), who just happens to be married to Ocean's former love Tess (Julia Roberts). Ocean's Eleven was updated by scribe Ted Griffin and marked the third feature shot by director Steven Soderbergh under the alias Peter Andrews(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore terraced properties in Staffordshire and south Wales, and a small cottage in need of renovation on a large plot in Surrey. They then discover what they sold for at auction and speak to the new owners about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: The Weston-super-Mare force use CCTV to track a suspected burglar. Neighbours complain about a house in Bridgwater - and police believe drugs are at the heart of the problem.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: The difficulties in getting a refund when cancelling a holiday, even when the travel company sell it on to someone else. Plus, Simon Calder has tips for exploring the Greek islands.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day nine at the All England Club, and looks ahead to the matches due to take place today, as well as the latest news. Coverage continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, where the men's quarter-final singles matches are due to take place, including Andy Murray v Sam Querrey and Milos Raonic v Roger Federer. Defending champion Murray will take nothing for granted against the man who eliminated Novak Djokovic from last year's competition. In the other match on Centre Court, 2016 runner-up Raonic faces a daunting task against Federer, as the Swiss star chases a record eighth Wimbledon title.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Martin Clunes joins Matt Baker and Alex Jones for a summer special live from Perranporth beach in Cornwall. Plus, live music by The Kooks.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: The team meets people whose vehicles have suddenly lost power in the middle of the road, and asks if one car giant's efforts to fix a problem are creating a more worrying concern. The results of hygiene tests into a business used by millions are revealed and the pressure sales techniques of a mobility furniture company are exposed.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Birmingham landlord Samuel is just 25 but already has a portfolio of 13 properties worth more than £1million in total, and lives off the combined rental income with his wife Amanda. The couple spend a week living in one of their houses, rented by mother-of-two Marie, to experience life from her perspective. Also taking part are husband-and-wife duo Paul and Sharon from Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, who move into a two-bedroom flat rented by Chris and Courtney. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Rob Delaney, Davina McCall and Laurence Fox competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including people who order starters, 12-string guitars and cyclists wearing Lycra.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the retailers' attempts to outdo one another in terms of convenience - one of the fastest-growing battlegrounds. Gregg Wallace discovers how supermarkets decide where to open small stores, while Babita Sharma travels to Spain on the trail of easy peel fruit. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: A busy mum who enjoys pricey beauty treatments is shown a few ways to pamper herself at a fraction of the cost. Plus, catching up with families who had a makeover last series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development of a garage in Margate, Kent, a ground-floor in London's Shepherd's Bush and a piece of land in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rav Wilding reports on an operation to reel in a suspected heroin dealer, a case involving a young shop worker suspected of stealing thousands of pounds' worth of items from his employer, and a neighbour from hell who has the tenants in her block of flats living in fear.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate why customers have been treated differently by the same holiday company when their complaints were the same.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from London's Portobello Road, as experts Natasha Raskin and Thomas Plant support the red and blue teams scouring the famous street market. Catherine Southon acts as auctioneer.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, featuring Venus Williams v Johanna Konta and Garbine Muguruza v Magdalena Rybarikova in the ladies' singles semi-finals. Konta is the first British lady to reach the last four since Virginia Wade in 1978, but faces a tough test against five-time champion Williams. Muguruza was a finalist here in 2015 and won last year's French Open, while Rybarikova has been something of a surprise package, having never previously been beyond the third round of a Grand Slam in a 12-year professional career.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Kevin Duala present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Steven grows increasingly paranoid when he is unable to find Lauren - and things comes to a head with the arrival of Josh. A nervous Bex prepares to perform at the showcase, but with Alexandra and Madison determined to cause trouble, will all go to plan? Michelle goes on another date with Tom, and Denny and Will seek revenge on Keegan, only for their prank to backfire.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers deal with a large group of squatters who have barricaded themselves inside a building in south London, Tommy and Craig meet a dealer who sold a potentially lethal second-hand car, and Lawrence and Kev face the prospect of seizing some heavy machinery in place of a large debt.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Choreographer and Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood becomes the latest celebrity to dig into his family's past in the popular genealogy show. Having lived and worked in Britain for the past 26 years, he now returns to his native Australia, curious to know if anyone else in the family was also involved in showbusiness. He discovers that one ancestor risked everything in the Australian gold rush, before a visit to his 100-year-old grandmother puts him on the trail of another maverick relative, who was the life and soul of the party. Sound like anyone we know?.(n)

programme.title: Murdered for Being Different
programme.desc: Fact-based drama telling the story of a brutal attack on a couple in a Lancashire park. Sophie Lancaster was kicked to death by a gang she didn't know, while her boyfriend Robert Maltby was beaten into a coma - and all because they were dressed as goths. Nico Mirallegro, Abigail Lawrie, Sally Lindsay and Chanel Cresswell star.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Gyles Brandreth recalls the Queen's coronation and a groundbreaking political satire as he joins Brian Conley to choose the TV that shaped his life.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis help a family desperate to save enough cash to adapt their home for a wheelchair, with experts looking to curb their impulsive spending habits.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help two teams of couples find bargains at an antiques fair in the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, with Anita Manning overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs prepare their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and newcomer Andi Oliver, who are joined by Davis Cup captain Leon Smith. Together, they decide which contestant to send through to represent the region in the national finals.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West chefs Dominic Chapman, Tom Brown and Andy Clatworthy go all out to impress with their starters. Returning chef Dominic serves up a complex summer salad, while newcomer Tom worries his elegant dish may fail to impress the veteran judge, and Andy hopes his mushroom-centred dish will secure his place at the banquet.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Including coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces coverage of the men's quarter-final singles matches, which are expected to be the main focus of attention on day nine, including the opening stages of Andy Murray v Sam Querrey, before attention switches to Court One for Gilles Muller v Marin Cilic and Tomas Berdych v Novak Djokovic. Muller will be hoping to have recovered from his epic five-set victory over Rafael Nadal in the previous round, as he takes on the big-serving Cilic. Djokovic is yet to drop a set in the tournament, but could face a tougher test against the 2010 runner-up.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the day's play, where the line-up for the men's singles semi-finals was due to be decided. In addition to detailed analysis of those contests there's a round-up of the latest headlines, as well as a look ahead to the ladies' singles semi-finals, which are scheduled for Centre Court tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Miles Jupp, Deirdre O'Kane and Phill Jupitus join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme `non sequiturs'. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by James O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: How Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust is pushing the boundaries of what is possible technologically, at a time when the Trust has a planned annual deficit of £41 million and savings need to be made across the board. Meanwhile, at Charing Cross Hospital, site of the Trust's specialist neurosurgery department, 28-year-old former dancer Ben needs an operation to remove a recurrent brain tumour, and at Hammersmith, 23-year-old primary school teacher Rosa has an infection on her mitral valve called endocarditis.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin face one of their biggest challenges yet as they try to help the Caan family from Glasgow, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their weekly food shop. Dad, Ryan is addicted to food shopping and loves to have a fridge bursting with food, while for convenience the family often opt for takeaways throughout the week too, sending their food bills spiraling out of control. Can Gregg and Chris get them cooking from scratch and ditch the takeaways?.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Medicine: Dr Weston's Casebook
programme.desc: Surgeon Gabriel Weston uncovers the workings of the human body, looking closely at case studies of individuals with extremely rare conditions. In the first edition, she meets seven-year-old Virsaviya, who was born with her heart on the outside of her ribcage, and Jeannie Peeper, who has a condition that sees her body growing an extra skeleton where there should be muscle.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites broadcaster Penny Smith to choose the TV programmes that have shaped her life, including children's saga The Singing Ringing Tree.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood help a young couple struggling to pay for their dream wedding, as they try to save enough money to finally make it up the aisle.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future.
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces coverage of day 10 at the All England Club, where the ladies' semi-final singles matches are due to take place. The opening contest at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament featured six-time champion Serena Williams in action against the unseeded Elena Vesnina, who was appearing in her first-ever Grand Slam semi-final. While the American's pedigree at SW19 is unquestionable, Vesnina had failed to progress beyond the second round during this decade, and had crashed out at the first time of asking 12 months previously, so would have to produce an almighty upset if she was to reach the final. As expected, it was the defending champion who emerged victorious, claiming a straightforward 6-2, 6-0 victory, as she continued her efforts to retain the title. Other matches scheduled to take place today include the semi-finals of the men's doubles competition.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the day's play, where the last-four matches of the ladies' singles draw would decide who progressed to Saturday's final. Plus, there's a round-up of the day's headlines, and a preview of the men's singles semi-finals, which are scheduled to feature on Centre Court tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Over the past two years, the staff of the Natural History Museum has undertaken a super-sized challenge - to take down its famous cast of a dinosaur skeleton in the entrance hall and replace it with an equally impressive skeleton of a blue whale - the largest animal to have lived. This documentary follows the teams of conservators and engineers as they take apart the diplodocus - known to staff and visitors as Dippy - bone by bone, ready for a countrywide tour and then get the whale ready to go on display - all without closing the museum to the public. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Tom Allen (the latter having just appeared romping around on Channel 4's Crystal Maze). As usual, the contestants engage in various rounds of topical stand-up and improvisation as they try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kamal Ahmed.(n)

programme.title: The Drug Trial: Emergency at the Hospital
programme.desc: On Monday, March 13, 2006, eight healthy young men took part in a clinical trial of an experimental drug known as TGN1412. The drug was intended to treat leukaemia and had already been successfully tested on monkeys but never on humans. However, it went terribly wrong, leaving six of the volunteers fighting for their lives. This drama-documentary tells the story of one of the most infamous medical emergencies in recent British history.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: A look at the work of shoemakers John Lobb, which has produced hand-crafted footwear for gentlemen since the 19th century and boasts Royal Warrants from Prince Philip and Prince Charles. The company uses methods that have barely changed since it was founded, from pencilled outlines on brown paper, to the cutting and stitching of leather and the final polishing. Zoe Wanamaker narrates.(n)

programme.title: Hunting the Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: In August 2015 two amateur researchers declared they had found a lost Nazi train buried in a railway cutting near Walbrzych in Silesia, southern Poland. This followed decades of local folklore that a train, loaded with gold, had vanished after leaving Wroclaw in early 1945. Dan Snow follows the treasure hunters as they embark on the hunt, while also investigating this extraordinary story that leads all the way to Adolf Hitler himself and his secret plans for this remote corner of the Third Reich during the closing months of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Sound Waves: The Symphony of Physics
programme.desc: Helen Czerski investigates the science behind familiar sounds as well as those humans cannot hear. At the Palace of Westminster, she teams up with scientists to carry out measurements using state-of-the-art lasers to reveal how Big Ben vibrates to create pressure waves in the air at particular frequencies. She also explores the science of the voice, inviting soprano Lesley Garrett to sing I Dreamed A Dream inside an MRI scanner to reveal how her vocal tract acts as a resonator, amplifying and shaping the sound from her larynx.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines how the railways stimulated great changes to the nation's economy, and encouraged a new generation of mechanical engineers, skilled workers, managers and accountants. Originally, local entrepreneurs viewed trains as vehicles for shifting raw materials, stock and goods, however it soon became clear that there was money to be made in transporting people.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia with Huw Edwards
programme.desc: The newsreader follows in the footsteps of settlers who travelled from Wales to Patagonia 150 years ago with the intention of creating a colony where their language and culture would endure. On arrival in South America, Huw meets descendants of the original immigrants and examines how much of their spirit lives on in the present.(n)

programme.title: The Renaissance Unchained
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak returns to Italy to trace the Renaissance from its perceived origins with Giotto and takes a look at the importance of religious narrative in Italian art. He reveals that the majority of Italian painting and sculpture in the 14th and 15th centuries was created to inspire devotion, especially in the work of Piero della Francesca, Michelangelo, Boticelli, Giotto, Leonardo, Raphael and Fra Angelico.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Solar Storms - The Threat to Planet Earth.
programme.desc: Scientists predict a fit of violent activity on the sun which will propel billions of tonnes of superheated gas and pulses of energy towards Earth. In 1989 one of these solar storms, which has the power to close down modern technology, cut off the power to the Canadian city of Quebec. Horizon meets the weathermen as they try to predict what is coming and organisations like the National Grid as they prepare for the cosmic tempest.(n)

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose tells the story of Captain James Cook's historic 1768 voyage to find a vast southern continent. No such land mass was discovered, but the crew of the Endeavour went on to Tahiti and Australia, which Cook claimed for Britain. The ship was almost ripped apart on the Great Barrier Reef, but the captain's navigational skills eventually steered it back home to safety.(n)

programme.title: Hunting the Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: In August 2015 two amateur researchers declared they had found a lost Nazi train buried in a railway cutting near Walbrzych in Silesia, southern Poland. This followed decades of local folklore that a train, loaded with gold, had vanished after leaving Wroclaw in early 1945. Dan Snow follows the treasure hunters as they embark on the hunt, while also investigating this extraordinary story that leads all the way to Adolf Hitler himself and his secret plans for this remote corner of the Third Reich during the closing months of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Maggie Aderin-Pocock and Chris Lintott report on the presence of trans-Neptunian objects, a large number of minor planets on the edge of the solar system, many with moons of their own and unusual orbits. Plus, Marcus du Sautoy reveals how the mathematical study of these objects may increase our understanding of how the solar system was created.(n)

programme.title: Castles - Britain's Fortified History
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis explores how castles came under threat from the cannon during the Wars of the Roses, before their whole purpose was transformed in the Tudor era when some of the buildings became palaces to impress monarchs such as Elizabeth I. However, just as they seemed to have lost their defensive function the English Civil War erupted. Sam also looks at their legacy and how they remain popular to this day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: New series. Danielle George trawls five decades of the BBC archive to explore how documentary-makers have interpreted major natural disasters, including the legendary loss of Atlantis and the eruption that destroyed Pompeii, and how they have changed their approach in the light of new scientific theories.(n)

programme.title: Atlantis - The Evidence
programme.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes presents a documentary unravelling the legend of Atlantis, which is considered one of the most intriguing mysteries of all time. She investigates evidence discovered by scientists that suggests it was inspired by one of the greatest natural disasters of the ancient world - a tsunami that hit Crete in 1500 BC.(n)

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Bernado explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.sub-title: The Only Easy Day Is Yesterday.
programme.desc: Three men stage a raid on a drug deal, taking a suitcase full of cash and killing the dealer and an undercover LAPD officer. Eric studies the details of his unit and finds that a man called Jackson has been unaccounted for since the day of the attack. Drama, starring LL Cool J.(n)
