programme.desc: The Devil Wears Nada. Marge poses for a "Philanthro-Chicks" calendar to raise money for charity, and the photographer eases her inhibitions with wine, resulting in some provocative photos that make her the talk of the town(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield
programme.desc: Once Upon a Time in Springfield. In the 450th episode, Krusty the Clown teams up with a female costar, Princess Penelope (voice of Anne Hathaway), and before long he proposes marriage to her. Meanwhile, Mr. Burns and the workers clash at the nuclear power plant. Guest voices include Eartha Kitt and Jackie Mason(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Moe Goes From Rags to Riches
programme.desc: Moe Goes From Rags to Riches. Moe's beloved bar rag, loomed as an ornate medieval tapestry, recounts its millennium-spanning life story. And when the rag goes missing, the supposedly friendless Moe realises that he has more friends than he thought. Meanwhile, Bart begs Milhouse for forgiveness after they get into a fight(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: To Courier With Love. Homer promises Marge her dream holiday to Paris, and then to defray the cost he makes a deal with the travel agent to act as a courier and transport a briefcase with top-secret info on the trip(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Motherless Child. A mysterious stranger surfaces and asks Archer to help him find his birth mother(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Bel Panto: Part I. Part 1 of 2. A fundraiser goes awry due to party crashers(n)

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killer's social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers.(n)

programme.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
programme.desc: Historical drama set during the Crimean War, in which British military commanders order a disastrous attack on Russian gun positions, causing the needless slaughter of hundreds of cavalrymen. Starring David Hemmings, Vanessa Redgrave, John Gielgud, Trevor Howard and Harry Andrews.(n)

programme.title: Tomahawk
programme.desc: Frontier scout Jim Bridger doesn't approve when a gold rush leads the US army to build a fort on land occupied by the Sioux. The situation goes from bad to worse when a sadistic officer launches an unprovoked attack, prompting a vengeful tribe to go on the offensive and leaving Bridger the only one who can save the soldiers at the fort from certain death. Western, starring Van Heflin, Yvonne de Carlo and Alex Nicol, and featuring an early appearance by Rock Hudson.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Spying
programme.desc: A secret formula is stolen by a sinister organisation masterminded by the evil Dr Crow. The British government plans to assign its top agents to deal with the crisis, but owing to staff shortages, has to settle for a bungling spy and his three hapless trainees. Comedy, starring Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Jim Dale, Eric Barker and Victor Maddern.(n)

programme.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
programme.desc: A girl grows up in 16th-century Europe under the iron fist of her stepmother, until the love of handsome Prince Henry offers a glimmer of hope. Unfortunately, the royal gent has worries of his own in the shape of an arranged marriage. Luckily, Renaissance genius Leonardo da Vinci is on hand to play fairy godfather and bring the pair together. Romantic drama, starring Drew Barrymore, Anjelica Huston, Dougray Scott and Timothy West.(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A scientist carries out genetic experiments on apes, hoping to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease. A chimpanzee used in the tests develops superior intelligence and becomes outraged at the human race's cruel treatment of his kind, forming his fellow primates into an army to overthrow mankind. Sci-fi thriller, starring James Franco, Freida Pinto and Andy Serkis.(n)

programme.title: Willow Creek
programme.desc: Two amateur film-makers visit the town near the woods that are supposedly home to Bigfoot. They intend to make a documentary about the locals and their monster-inspired tourist trade, but cannot resist trekking into the forest in the hope of proving the creature exists - a quest with terrifying consequences. Horror, starring Alexie Gilmore and Bryce Johnson.(n)

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A reporter survives an ecological catastrophe that struck a coastal town, killing hundreds of people in just 24 hours. The authorities have covered up the cause of the disaster, so she gathers together all the video footage in existence from that fateful day on a mission to expose the truth. Thriller, starring Kether Donohue and Kristen Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: A drifter rides into a town dominated by the members of a ruthless family. He befriends a Mexican in jail for killing a man who attacked his sister and tries to save him from the gallows, getting caught up in the evil clan's running internal conflicts in the process. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Craig Stevens, Manuel Rojas and Barry Kelley.(n)

programme.title: Arabian Nights
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson.(n)

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: A former Confederate soldier takes a job building the Santa Fe railroad after the end of the Civil War and tries to persuade his three brothers to join him, fearing they will otherwise fall into a life of crime owing to their enduring hatred of the North. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Jerome Courtland, Janis Carter and Peter Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Down to the Sea in Ships
programme.desc: Sea captain Bering Joy takes his grandson Jed on a whaling trip to teach him about life's challenges and truths, while first mate Dan Lunceford's assignment to look after the lad has dramatic consequences on a voyage packed with incident and danger. Seafaring adventure, starring Lionel Barrymore, Richard Widmark, and Dean Stockwell.(n)

programme.title: War of the Planet of the Apes Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Matt Reeves and star Andy Serkis talk about making the third film in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Seven English pensioners looking for a fresh start are drawn to an advert for a hotel in the Indian city of Jaipur, and plan to spend their retirement there. They arrive to find the building dilapidated but are won over by the enthusiastic young manager, and each embarks on their own adventures in the city. Comedy drama, starring Judi Dench, Bill Nighy, Maggie Smith and Dev Patel.(n)

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A colony of super-intelligent apes thrives following a global virus outbreak that wipes out much of the human race. A survivor tries to make peace with the leader of the apes, but their efforts to reach an understanding are threatened by warmongers on both sides. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Jason Clarke and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: Killing Them Softly
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks rob an illegal poker game run by the Mob. A hitman is sent to resolve the situation by either tracking down the culprits or making an example of the gangster who organised the game, but his decision to involve a washed-up old friend threatens the assignment. Crime thriller, starring Brad Pitt, James Gandolfini and Ray Liotta.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: MI5 use Peter's home as a safe house for a Russian defector, leaving him with a major diplomatic incident on his hands.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: The agents make a disastrous mistake during a mission, but a college lecturer helps to salvage the situation.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's suspicions about Paul's bad influence seem to be confirmed when he spots a half-naked woman in next door's back garden. Comedy, starring Richard Briers. First broadcast February 12, 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon finds a baby, and Carole's ex-husband pays a visit.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly spots a bottle with a message inside floating down the river, and decides to catch it - so enlists the help of Clegg, Billy and Alvin to follow its elusive course and eventually read the mysterious contents. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis, Keith Clifford and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The arrival of Clegg's cousin threatens to spell the end of the gang's gentle walks, so they resolve to get rid of him. Aubrey finds he can still beat Billy and Alvin cycling up hills, but discovers his own weakness. Starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright feels neglected by Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, and decides to elicit her undivided attention by feigning illness. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Local election fever hits the village and Geraldine finds she is a more popular candidate with the voters than over-confident parish council chairman David. Richard Curtis's comedy, starring Dawn French and Gary Waldhorn.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Prudish Basil resorts to increasingly desperate measures to prevent an unmarried couple lowering moral standards at his hotel. programme.desc: Prudish Basil resorts to increasingly desperate measures to prevent an unmarried couple lowering moral standards at his hotel. Unfortunately, as his efforts become increasingly frantic, he succeeds only in making a fool of himself. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: David Jason stars in this follow-up to Roy Clarke's popular comedy Open All Hours. Once the dogsbody, Granville has inherited the business from his miserly uncle Albert Arkwright, but he is not alone in running the shop - he now has his own assistant in the shape of his son Leroy, who proves more popular with the ladies than his dad ever did. It's a typical day at the grocer's as Granville tries to get a date with old flame Mavis without her terrifying sister Madge finding out, while Leroy shuns the old delivery bike in favour of an altogether more attractive way to take out the orders. James Baxter and Lynda Baron co-star, with appearances by Johnny Vegas, Mark Williams, Brigit Forsyth, Nina Wadia and Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Jean vents her anger on the customers, while Tony considers asking Bren to accompany him on a trip to Marbella. Petula returns with interesting news, and Anita celebrates the second week of her relationship with Pedro. Victoria Wood stars.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Dee, Jason Manford & Russell Howard.
programme.desc: Jack Dee hosts the stand-up show from London's Hammersmith Apollo, with guest comedians Jason Manford and Russell Howard. Between them, the trio regale the audience with their thoughts on the polar ice-caps, wimpy professional footballers, canine funerals, internet dating and muggers.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark is distraught after being mugged by two teenagers, and becomes oblivious to Sophie's advances. Jeremy faces a moral dilemma as he waits for the return of his girlfriend, but is offered a threesome. Comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Mr Balowski becomes a mad axeman and chases the bachelor boys into Narnia as a flood of biblical proportions engulfs London. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Dee, Jason Manford & Russell Howard.
programme.desc: Jack Dee hosts the stand-up show from London's Hammersmith Apollo, with guest comedians Jason Manford and Russell Howard. Between them, the trio regale the audience with their thoughts on the polar ice-caps, wimpy professional footballers, canine funerals, internet dating and muggers.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: The comedy duo present a parody of Federico Fellini's movies. Featuring Kate Moss and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: When Miss Postern sets up a careers workshop, it seems her slogan `Which Way Now?' applies as much to her as it does to the pupils, not least because the guest speaker is her old teacher-training colleague - and now best-selling children's author - Fenella Forbes (played by Morgana Robinson). Meanwhile, her relationship with Mr Church has taken a downward turn after a misunderstanding over a date. On the upside, the future is looking bright for one member of staff, as Mr Martin prepares to launch a pop career. With David Walliams, Catherine Tate, Daniel Rigby, Philip Glenister, Frances de la Tour and a guest appearance by Cheryl Fergison (formerly EastEnders favourite Heather Trott).(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders' spoof of the Batman movies. Guest starring Patsy Kensit and Kate Moss.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Bubbles Devere spends too much time under the sunbed, while Sebastian and Michael meet the US President and his assistant Marvin. Anne gains a job in a bowling alley and Andy learns to ride a horse. Comedy sketches, written by and starring Matt Lucas and David Walliams, with Anthony Head.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity causes mayhem when a Russian hitman is sent after the wrong target.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: The bungling spy has to stop Lewis and Dexter from infiltrating a group of animal activists.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin looks forward to his annual Austrian holiday with Anne, Howard and Hilda. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Wilton. First broadcast February 19, 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: An underwater wedding is held in the main swimming pool, but a drunk in an electric wheelchair disrupts the proceedings and Gavin gets shot with a harpoon. To add to the general chaos, chlorine gas gradually fills the entire Leisure Centre. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen Barry's Midlife Crisis?.
programme.desc: Truly's plans to rescue Howard from his bedroom are given a boost when Auntie Wainwright puts some lightweight scaffolding up for sale - ideal for springing someone imprisoned on an upper floor. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Genuine Outdoors Robin Hood Barbi.
programme.desc: Billy promises the gang a perfect barbecue in the great outdoors - without a newfangled portable contraption - and takes Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle into the Dales. He knows the ideal spot - if he can just remember how to find it. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry in Danger from Reading and Aunt Jessie.
programme.desc: Nora Batty spots Alvin with a mystery woman, and convinces herself that the couple are becoming close after some devious work by the elderly Lothario and a blushing Billy. Pearl spots a lonely hearts advertisement that she is sure is from Howard. Kathy Staff, Brian Murphy and Keith Clifford star.(n)

programme.desc: College students cause chaos during their traditional rag-week fundraiser, stretching the local constabulary's patience to breaking point. Unfortunately DI Grim has other matters on his mind - like dealing with a real-life bank raid. Ben Elton's comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and David Haig.(n)

programme.title: Come Fly with Me
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and David Walliams star in this spoof fly-on-the-wall documentary set in a busy airport. In the opening episode, 80-year-old Hetty Wolf takes her first flight, husband-and-wife pilots Simon and Jackie sort out their marriage 35,000ft above Sweden and former Spice Girl Geri Halliwell puts in an appearance.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the stand-up show from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, London, with guest comedian Alan Carr. The funnymen talk about bullies, estate agents and bread-making machines.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes looks after a robotic baby that has been given to Dermot and Maria to help them prepare for their new arrival, but uses unorthodox methods to stop the fake infant from crying. Meanwhile, Cathy develops a crush on her psychology lecturer. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: After four weeks of competition the semi-finals begin, and the eight remaining contenders must prepare a dish to impress judge Gregg Wallace. They have just two hours to demonstrate their skill, flair and ability to deliver perfect flavours and immaculate presentation, with only the six best chefs progressing to the next stage.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw visits the Hokuriku region, uncovering the secrets to superb sake, sampling sushi and preparing a classic Japanese dish with his mother-in-law.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood assess the remaining contestants' dessert-making skills. The hopefuls start by creating tortes before tackling this week's technical test - the delicate French dish of creme caramel. Though these two rounds provide a stern examination of the amateurs' creative flair and technical ability, they then face possibly the toughest task of the series so far - a six-hour challenge to create a show-stopping layered meringue. Once the sugar has set, who will be this week's Star Baker, and who will be going home? Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After five weeks of heats, 60 hopefuls have been whittled down to the most promising 10. But if they thought it was tough getting this far, the knockout stage will really sort the dishwashers from the chefs, as over the next two nights the remaining contestants are split into two groups of five and get their first taste of professional cooking. Tonight's group heads to London's Caxton Grill, where 2013 MasterChef: The Professionals finalist Adam Handling is head chef for a busy lunchtime service. Then it's back to the studio to rustle up a dish from an array of seasonal produce for renowned chef Marcus Wareing and the judges, John Torode and Gregg Wallace, who will then send one of the hopefuls home.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how the seasonality of Britain's weather has forced people to devise ingenious ways of storing food through the winter months, revealing that tasty dishes have evolved from a need to preserve.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adelaide is the next stop for the chef, who considers what makes a first-class burger and hunts down freshwater yabbies on the coast.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists are challenged to work a shift at the two Michelin-starred Dinner by Heston Blumenthal restaurant in Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park hotel in Knightsbridge, central London. Head chef Ashley Palmer-Watts then asks them to make salamugundy - a salad of chicken oysters, roasted salsify, bone marrow and horseradish - which is one of the establishment's signature dishes. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, who pick one to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants' pie-making skills are put to the test in a trio of demanding tasks. First, the hopefuls try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry by making beef Wellington, before creating hand-raised pies during this round's technical challenge - but several of the cooks run into difficulties as they try to work with a pastry dolly for the first time. Finally, the showstopper challenge sees traditional American pies being prepared - before one more baker is eliminated from the competition. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second lot of five hopefuls try their hand at professional service, preparing lunch at the Grain Store, a London restaurant overseen by classically trained chef Bruno Loubet. With paying customers to satisfy, they soon feel the weight of responsibility - who will rise to the challenge? The hopefuls then have a chance to show what they have learnt by rustling up a dish in an invention test, choosing from an array of seasonal produce - but in an unexpected twist, they also present their food to renowned chef Marcus Wareing. He then helps John Torode and Gregg Wallace evaluate the five amateurs before they decide which one has gone far enough in the competition.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate quality produce that needs to be cooked with the respect it deserves, as they continue their culinary journey through time. The duo argue that, while convenience food serves a purpose, only the best ingredients and perfect cooking can produce something truly delicious.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new `Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: In the first a two-part edition filmed in Melbourne, the chef catches up with his mentor and considers his home city's best restaurants, before rustling up a barbecue in Torquay.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants' pie-making skills are put to the test in a trio of demanding tasks. programme.desc: The presenter lights up a barbecue in the heart of his vegetable garden and prepares a selection of fresh dishes, demonstrating how food can be taken from the patch to the plate in minutes. With food historian Annie Gray.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new `Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: In the first a two-part edition filmed in Melbourne, the chef catches up with his mentor and considers his home city's best restaurants, before rustling up a barbecue in Torquay.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate quality produce that needs to be cooked with the respect it deserves, as they continue their culinary journey through time. The duo argue that, while convenience food serves a purpose, only the best ingredients and perfect cooking can produce something truly delicious.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second lot of five hopefuls try their hand at professional service, preparing lunch at the Grain Store, a London restaurant overseen by classically trained chef Bruno Loubet. With paying customers to satisfy, they soon feel the weight of responsibility - who will rise to the challenge? The hopefuls then have a chance to show what they have learnt by rustling up a dish in an invention test, choosing from an array of seasonal produce - but in an unexpected twist, they also present their food to renowned chef Marcus Wareing. He then helps John Torode and Gregg Wallace evaluate the five amateurs before they decide which one has gone far enough in the competition.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants' pie-making skills are put to the test in a trio of demanding tasks. First, the hopefuls try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry by making beef Wellington, before creating hand-raised pies during this round's technical challenge - but several of the cooks run into difficulties as they try to work with a pastry dolly for the first time. Finally, the showstopper challenge sees traditional American pies being prepared - before one more baker is eliminated from the competition. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists are challenged to work a shift at the two Michelin-starred Dinner by Heston Blumenthal restaurant in Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park hotel in Knightsbridge, central London. Head chef Ashley Palmer-Watts then asks them to make salamugundy - a salad of chicken oysters, roasted salsify, bone marrow and horseradish - which is one of the establishment's signature dishes. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, who pick one to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this cryptic sci-fi adventure from writer/director Jeff Nichols, Roy (Michael Shannon) rescues his son Alton (Jaeden Lieberher) from a religious cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. Kirsten Dunst, Adam Driver, and Sam Shepard co-star(n)

There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. Eva Green, Samuel L. Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. Directed by Tim Burton, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children was adapted from Ransom Riggs' debut novel of the same name(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: The stunning romantic drama which won a total of nine Oscars and focuses on a mysterious man who is almost killed in a 'plane crash in Africa during World War II. He survives, but with ghastly burns to his flesh, and is cared for by a young nurse (Juliette Binoche) in a derelict monastery in Italy. As the stories of his life before the accident and the woman who fell for him gradually unfold, the nurse finds her own romantic life taking an interesting turn, encouraged by her curious new patient..(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy/ drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing (and the paper's readership). The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Jovovich and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A mysterious loner assumes the responsibility of protecting a newborn from a group of men determined to kill the child in first-time director/screenwriter Michael Davis' nonstop, adrenaline-fueled action film. Mr. Smith (Clive Owen) is the last man that a parent would want to have looking after their child, yet after stumbling upon a blazing shoot-out, helping to birth a child amidst a hail of gunfire, and seeing the mother die before his eyes, he becomes determined to protect the young innocent at all costs. But his adversaries are equally determined, and they will not stop until the newborn is dead. Now, in order to ensure that maniacal criminal mastermind Mr. Hertz (Paul Giamatti) and his gang of henchmen do not succeed in accomplishing their nefarious goal, Mr. Smith joins forces with a prostitute known as the Dairy Queen (Monica Bellucci), who specializes in lactation fetishes, and flees into the bowels of the city while facing almost certain death on every street corner(n)

programme.desc: In this cryptic sci-fi adventure from writer/director Jeff Nichols, Roy (Michael Shannon) rescues his son Alton (Jaeden Lieberher) from a religious cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. Kirsten Dunst, Adam Driver, and Sam Shepard co-star(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: Troubled psychologist George Clooney is sent to investigate the crew of an isolated research station orbiting a bizarre planet(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake (Asa Butterfield) follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. Eva Green, Samuel L. Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. Directed by Tim Burton, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children was adapted from Ransom Riggs' debut novel of the same name(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Upbeat musical spin on John Waters' 1988 cult hit about a plump, socially conscious teenage girl who shakes up things on a TV dance show in 1962 Baltimore(n)

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: In the near-future, tough mercenary Toorop is hired to transport a girl from Russia to New York, unaware that she is believed by some to be the new messiah(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Meg Altman buys an old brownstone apartment fitted with a 'panic room', a secret, state-of-the-art chamber to hide from burglars. She never thought she'd need it, until she heard the glass break downstairs... Stylish, suspense thriller(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 163. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: 8
programme.desc: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael performs in New York City at Masonic Hall. Topics include Donald Trump's victory; climate change; supporting the troops; animal rights; being a good boyfriend; and his top four fears(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Racist as F**k. Jared meets Molly's friends; Issa confronts her coworkers' lack of confidence in her; Lawrence is taken aback by a headhunter's remarks; Molly's pep talk to a new summer associate at work fails to connect(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonising that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: Using a pioneering technique, a psychologist enters the mind of a comatose serial killer to try to locate his most recent victim(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: The stunning romantic drama which won a total of nine Oscars and focuses on a mysterious man who is almost killed in a 'plane crash in Africa during World War II. He survives, but with ghastly burns to his flesh, and is cared for by a young nurse (Juliette Binoche) in a derelict monastery in Italy. As the stories of his life before the accident and the woman who fell for him gradually unfold, the nurse finds her own romantic life taking an interesting turn, encouraged by her curious new patient..(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy/ drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing (and the paper's readership). The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: A priest's visions bring FBI agents Mulder and Scully back together for an investigation involving the mysterious disappearance of a group of women(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: A macho ad exec is suddenly able to read women's minds---much to his chagrin(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Bloom
programme.desc: The Brothers Bloom are the best con men in the world, swindling millionaires with complex scenarios of lust and intrigue. Now they've decided to take on one last job - showing a beautiful and eccentric heiress the time of her life with a romantic adventure that takes them around the world(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This reimagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Jovovich and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: The pot-smoking friends are suspected of being terrorists(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 164. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A mysterious loner assumes the responsibility of protecting a newborn from a group of men determined to kill the child in first-time director/screenwriter Michael Davis' nonstop, adrenaline-fueled action film. Mr. Smith (Clive Owen) is the last man that a parent would want to have looking after their child, yet after stumbling upon a blazing shoot-out, helping to birth a child amidst a hail of gunfire, and seeing the mother die before his eyes, he becomes determined to protect the young innocent at all costs. But his adversaries are equally determined, and they will not stop until the newborn is dead. Now, in order to ensure that maniacal criminal mastermind Mr. Hertz (Paul Giamatti) and his gang of henchmen do not succeed in accomplishing their nefarious goal, Mr. Smith joins forces with a prostitute known as the Dairy Queen (Monica Bellucci), who specializes in lactation fetishes, and flees into the bowels of the city while facing almost certain death on every street corner(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Game Day. In the Season 2 finale, Spencer takes a final stab at regaining what he's lost; Ricky waits for a call that will determine his future; Vernon goes on a road trip; and Charles gets an offer from Siefert that could be more trouble than it's worth(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman and Superman clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor(n)

programme.title: Kicks
programme.desc: A black 15-year-old finally gets his hands on a coveted pair of Air Jordan sneakers, only to see them stolen by a local thug. With the help of two of his friends, he decides to embark on an adventure through inner-city Oakland to retrieve them(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Now fully recovered from his amnesia, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne attempts to uncover the truth behind his father's death in this pulse-pounding sequel. At the same time, he must evade the government forces hot on his trail(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Bridget worries about her relationship with Darcy and is upset when work reunites her with the womanising Daniel, in this sequel to "Bridget Jones's Diary"(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: Gothic horror story set in modern-day San Francisco about a two-hundred-year-old vampire who decides to reveal all about his existence to an increasingly beguiled tabloid journalist. Weary with wandering the world in search of fresh prey, the blood-sucking fiend takes time out to recall vignettes from a past life that embraces two centuries and four continents(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: Selfish publicist Stu Shepherd answers a ringing phone in the street. Not only does the man on the line know his name, but he's also got a sniper's rifle pointed directly at Stu(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: Director: Peter Chelsom. A couple reunite years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: Selfish publicist Stu Shepherd answers a ringing phone in the street. Not only does the man on the line know his name, but he's also got a sniper's rifle pointed directly at Stu(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.title: The Limey
programme.desc: British ex-con Wilson arrives in Los Angeles to investigate the mystery of his daughter's "accidental" death. His prime suspect, the wealthy, heavily guarded, music promoter Terry Valentine, is no easy target. Propelled into an increasingly brutal search for truth, Wilson, with single-mindedness and terrifying precision, moves unstoppably toward revenge(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realisation that they scared away their best friend's fiancée, hard-partying friends Evan and Jason set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Writer-director Andrew Dominik's thoughtful, elegiac saga is a dead-on throwback to classic Westerns of yore. Brad Pitt gives a bang-up performance as the notorious outlaw living out his final days in 1882 before being gunned down by a member of his gang (Casey Affleck). Features a cameo by political pundit James Carville as Governor Crittenden and rocker Nick Cave as a saloon singer. Cave also co-wrote the score. Actor-playwright Sam Shepard costars as Jesse's brother Frank(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Unshaven, chain-smoking archangel Michael is discovered in an elderly woman's home by a group of cynical tabloid reporters, who resolve to prove his existence to the world. Their cross-country journey becomes a quest for both redemption and love(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: An accountant moonlights as a hit man(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: Freeman is hired to chauffeur the difficult Tandy in racially tense 1960's South. The two develop an eventual relationship and love for each other with terrific performances across the board and enough sincerity to break even the toughest audience(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood plays Will Munny, a rancher who gave up his bullets for pig farming long ago. He's forced out of retirement by the search for money to feed his children, but struggles with his past and the fear of a return to his old, murdering ways. Gene Hackman turns in a powerful performance as the corrupt sherriff who deals brutally with the bounty hunters and taunts Munny by comparing their need for violence. Eastwood undermines his Man With No Name persona and plays effectively on his grey-haired appearance. This is a bold and compelling Western(n)

programme.desc: A man (Sam Rockwell) attempts to pull his life together by teaching his daughter's (Emma Roberts) high-school basketball team in this indie comedy by Grace Is Gone writer/director James C. Strouse. Rob Corddry co-stars in this Gigi/Plum Pictures production(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Lew Schneider. Lew Schneider comments on New York City, appliances, marriage, parenthood and religion. Taped in Miami Beach(n)

programme.title: Off Air
programme.desc: Off Air(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: This fun-loving romantic comedy follows a young New Yorker (Alexis Bledel) as she searches for the perfect man. A Wall Street big shot (Scott Porter) seems like the real deal, until she meets his handsome coworker (Bryan Greenberg) and comes to realize love is as big of a gamble as the stock market(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Unshaven, chain-smoking archangel Michael is discovered in an elderly woman's home by a group of cynical tabloid reporters, who resolve to prove his existence to the world. Their cross-country journey becomes a quest for both redemption and love(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. This raucous comedy-drama is based on true events(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: A fictional romance between a struggling young playwright named Shakespeare and a noblewoman who longs to act, and who inspires him to write "Romeo and Juliet"(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Gilbert Gottfried: Command Performance. Gilbert Gottfried harasses the audience; shares his theories on turtle care and on Elvis; imitates other comedians; and uses ripped napkins as props(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Semi-autobiographical tale from Spike Lee based on his childhood growing up in 70s New York. Young Troy watches her parents fight over money, and gets a chance to see how the other half lives when she visits wealthy cousins in the country(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Comedy adventure set during the Vietnam War about a group of US soldiers who attempt to bring an elephant through the jungle for a friendly native village. A pair of army officers offer to find a new elephant for local villagers when their sacred beast becomes a casualty of war. Along with a trio of hapless assistants, they set off on a mission to deliver the animal to its new home(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Goofy Tom and rich kid Sarah head to Venice on honeymoon. He's worried about her ex, who has followed them; she's concerned that Tom only wants to watch TV. Either way, they're unlikely to make it home together(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: A fictional romance between a struggling young playwright named Shakespeare and a noblewoman who longs to act, and who inspires him to write "Romeo and Juliet"(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Zany horror spoof about a talented brain surgeon trapped in marriage to a malicious wife whose affections are shared with everyone but her husband. A serial elevator killer is on the loose, and the good doctor finds himself in love with the disembodied brain of one of the killer's victims. All he needs is a body to put it in(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Movie mogul and former gangster Chili Palmer is itching for a new project. He decides to make his first foray into the music business - but his ambition to turn a female performer into a star leaves him with a price on his head(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: A feisty television producer is torn between an ambitious yet dim anchorman and her closest confidant, a cynical veteran reporter(n)

programme.title: Bushwhacked
programme.desc: Comic tale of an incompetent delivery man, wrongly accused of murder, who hides out in a scout camp and has to endure a series of harrowing outdoor adventures(n)

programme.title: Bustin' Loose
programme.desc: An ex-con bonds with a school teacher and eight emotionally disturbed children as he drives them to a farm in rural Washington(n)

programme.title: Making of 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2'
programme.desc: A look at "My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2," a 2016 sequel to the 2002 hit that follows the Portokalos clan as they celebrate another momentous walk down the aisle. The film stars Nia Vardalos, John Corbett, Lainie Kazan and Michael Constantine, and is directed by Kirk Jones(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Donna, an independent, single mother who owns a small hotel on an idyllic Greek island, is about to let go of Sophie, the spirited daughter she's raised alone. For Sophie's wedding, Donna has invited her two lifelong best girlfriends--practical and no-nonsense Rosie and wealthy, multi-divorcee Tonya--from her one-time backing band, Donna and the Dynamos. programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A down-on-his luck auteur gets one more chance at the big time -- provided his neuroses don't swallow him whole -- in Woody Allen's 33rd feature release, Hollywood Ending. Allen plays Val Waxman, a one-time cinematic genius who's resorted to taking advertisement work to pay the bills for himself and his airhead live-in girlfriend, Lori (Debra Messing). Val finds his luck is about to change, however, when he receives the script for The City Never Sleeps, a period noir set against the backdrop of 1940s New York City. It seems his ex-wife, Ellie (Tea Leoni), now an executive at Galaxy Pictures, has been pulling for him to direct the picture, claiming he's the only man who can do justice to the script. She even manages to convince her boyfriend, Hal (Treat Williams), Galaxy's high-powered studio head, to take a chance on Val's "unique vision." Just when the cameras are ready to roll, however, Val finds that unique vision in jeopardy -- literally -- as he's struck with a psychosomatic case of blindness. When physicians and psychiatrists fail to cure him, Val contrives a scheme to forge ahead with the picture, for fear of blowing his one last chance at greatness. Hollywood Ending co-stars George Hamilton and Mark Rydell(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman, Daniel Craig and Dakota Blue Richards star in Chris Weitz's family fantasy-adventure, based on the first book in Philip Pullman's His Dark Materials trilogy. Twelve-year-old orphan Lyra Belacqua lives in an Oxford college, where the staff do their best to push her enquiring mind down conventional educational routes. One day, having sneaked into a private meeting of the college's dons, Lyra learns of mysterious events taking place in the Arctic. Soon after, amid news of mysterious child abductors called the 'Gobblers', her best friend Roger (Ben Walker) vanishes. The fearless Lyra sets off, determined to rescue her playmate. But Lyra's is a parallel universe: one with Victorian-style technology; where people's souls take the visible form of character-suggesting animals; witches and talking, armoured polar bears rule the cold lands of the north; and an organisation called The Magisterium aims to assert its authority. Lyra's journey will prove a dangerous one that uncovers the terrible truth linking the Gobblers and the Arctic phenomenon she heard about in Oxford. Also starring Eva Green, and the voices of Freddie Highmore and Ian McKellan. Sadly, it now seems the following two films in the series are fated not to be made. Even so, this stands as a stirring, thoughtful family adventure that's reasonably true to Pullman's masterpiece(n)

But as he rises up the ladder, so he learns of the firm's illegal actions and tries to get his father, a judge, to help him. programme.title: New Best Friend
programme.desc: Three rich, pretty people befriend their poor, mousy classmate and live to regret it in this teen-centric thriller. Alicia (Mia Kirshner), Hadley (Meredith Monroe), Julianne (Rachel True), and Sydney (Dominique Swain) are four students enrolled in the same sociology class at Colby University, an exclusive and respected college in the Carolinas. Alicia is a local girl born into modest circumstances who struggles to make ends meet and rarely gets a second look from the male students on campus, while Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney are close friends who all come from wealthy families and seem more concerned with partying than their studies. Alicia and Hadley are paired up to work on their semester project for the class, which is to be centered around the theme "Lead, Follow, or Get Out of the Way." As part of the project, Hadley decides to befriend Alicia, and brings her into her social circle. At first, Alicia seems more than grateful for the attention of her new friends, and blooms under the influence of Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney. But it isn't long before Alicia's personality begins to shift; she develops a powerful appetite for drugs and alcohol, and soon begins taking advantage of her new friendships. Things come to a head when Alicia seduces Sydney's boyfriend, Josh (Oliver Hudson), and soon Alicia ends up in the hospital after OD'ing on drugs. Artie Bonner (Taye Diggs), a local sheriff, begins looking into Alicia's case, convinced that her near-fatal accident with drugs was no accident at all(n)

Henry (Rudd) and Kate (Longoria Parker) were all prepared to live out their "happily ever after" when tragedy struck from out of nowhere and Kate was killed on their wedding day. In the aftermath of the accident, a devastated Paul reluctantly takes his sister's advice and pays a visit to local psychic Ashley (Bell). Now, despite the fact that he openly questions her ability to communicate with the dearly departed, Paul can't help but fall head over heels in love with Ashley. Despite the fact that the feelings are most certainly mutual, however, their growing relationship is threatened when Kate makes it her supernatural mission to sabotage the happy couple's fledgling relationship before it starts to get serious(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A mysterious loner assumes the responsibility of protecting a newborn from a group of men determined to kill the child in first-time director/screenwriter Michael Davis' nonstop, adrenaline-fueled action film. Mr. Smith (Clive Owen) is the last man that a parent would want to have looking after their child, yet after stumbling upon a blazing shoot-out, helping to birth a child amidst a hail of gunfire, and seeing the mother die before his eyes, he becomes determined to protect the young innocent at all costs. But his adversaries are equally determined, and they will not stop until the newborn is dead. Now, in order to ensure that maniacal criminal mastermind Mr. Hertz (Paul Giamatti) and his gang of henchmen do not succeed in accomplishing their nefarious goal, Mr. Smith joins forces with a prostitute known as the Dairy Queen (Monica Bellucci), who specializes in lactation fetishes, and flees into the bowels of the city while facing almost certain death on every street corner(n)

programme.title: Grey Gardens
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore and Jessica Lange headline this fact-based drama centered on the two eccentric relatives of Jackie Kennedy-Onassis who served as the subject of David and Albert Maysles' similarly-titled 1975 documentary. Directed, produced, and co-written (along with Patricia Rozema) by Michael Sucsy, Grey Gardens tells the story of Big Edie (Lange) and Little Edie (Barrymore), the aunt and cousin of Kennedy-Onassis respectively. The reclusive socialites made headlines across the country when the health department threatened to raid their sprawling, flea-and-raccoon-infested twenty-eight room East Hampton, NY mansion in the early-1970s, prompting Kennedy-Onassis herself to intervene in an attempt to save the family name. Jane Tripplehorn stars as former first lady Kennedy-Onassis in a film also featuring Daniel Baldwin, Ken Howard, Malcolm Gets, and Ayre Gross(n)

programme.title: Cocoon: The Return
programme.desc: Daniel Petric rises to the challenge of directing this sequel to Ron Howard's successful original. Those who chose immortality with the Antareans return with the aliens. The visitors are back to rescue a cocoon found on the ocean floor and now the subject of scientific investigation, while the immortal old folk are back to visit growing grandsons and ageing friends. Once again, Don Ameche, Jessica Tandy and Hume Cronyn - as Arthur Selwyn, Alma Finley and Joseph Finley respectively - steal the film, but new face Elaine Strich, as Ruby Steinberg, the hotel owner the others try to fix up with stay-behind Bernard Lefkowitz, is also a delight. As the two plots merge, can the Antareans rescue their friend, and will the immortals return or stay on Earth to grow old and die? Edited for content(n)

She begins in Manchester with the Harling family, helping working mum Lorraine deal with her fussy kids, who only want to eat chicken dippers. programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: Piers travels to Gadsden Correctional Facility near Tallahassee in Florida, where he hears the story of Ashley Humphrey. As a 20-year-old in 2003, she pumped eight bullets into barmaid Sandee Rozzo - a crime for which she is now serving 25 years. Piers tries to understand how she came to commit the crime, wondering whether she was persuaded by her domineering and abusive husband - who was being accused of rape by the victim - or if she is simply a cold-blooded killer who came up with the plan herself.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hudson is angered by James's decision to invite his father's secretary to lunch in the family dining room, and promptly tenders his resignation. Shortly after his wife leaves for New York, Richard receives the news that his work is to be published and wires her aboard the ship she is travelling on - the RMS Titanic.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert faces a traumatic first day back at work, and David confronts a difficult patient, but ends up fighting to save his own skin. Cathy is made to feel piggy in the middle, while WPc Mandie makes her feelings clear to Stuart. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and David Harewood.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick awaits the arrival in Aidensfield of a violent criminal recently released from prison, and Kate finds herself cut off by snow when she tries to help a heavily pregnant patient get to hospital. Meanwhile, Greengrass braves the harsh weather himself when his faithful canine companion Alfred goes missing. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: The Grand
programme.desc: An unwelcome guest brings traumatic memories to the surface, and the Grand is thrown into crisis. Period drama, starring Michael Siberry and Susan Hampshire.(n)

programme.desc: King John strips the Sheriff of his power for failing to capture the outlaws, and replaces him with Philip Mark, a man renowned for his ruthlessness. Meanwhile, Nasir encounters a fellow Saracen whose combat skills eclipse his own.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew tries to convince his friend Ronnie Neale that he has a serious illness, an unenviable task at the best of times and one complicated by the prospect of losing Dawn to her estranged husband Keith. Meanwhile, confusion abounds as Sam and Joanna are called out separately to the same patient. Starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Sarah Parish.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick faces a dilemma after one of his colleagues is suspected of robbery and Greengrass develops a keen interest in a villager's greyhound. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: The aftermath of the Titanic disaster causes conflict within the household, as Miss Forrest gradually assumes more responsibility - and no one is more incensed than Lady Bellamy's personal maid, who escaped the tragedy on a life-raft.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine agrees to spend the day with Andrew, and Mike finally breaks his vow of silence, digging over a minefield of painful memories with Stella. New doctor Kate Brady wastes no time in impressing Louise with her capable handling of a difficult case, while David very nearly reaches the end of his tether, thanks to a particularly awkward patient.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A young woman asks Poirot to investigate her father's murder - a 14-year-old crime for which her mother was found guilty and executed. The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Trish returns to the scene of the crime in the hope it will prompt her to remember something more about the attack, while DC Katie Harford thinks she has a strong lead when she discovers a new suspect who doesn't have an alibi. Cath reveals interesting new information about the night of her party, while a match is made for the male DNA found on Trish. An unknown woman walks into the police station - and delivers some devastating new information when interviewed by Ellie and Hardy. Crime drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the mysterious death of businessman John Shearwood, found floating in the water under the Gateshead Millennium Bridge when he was supposed to be on a golfing trip to Ireland. The man's wife Stella and brother Luke are baffled to discover he was working as an informant for HM Revenue and Customs. Chief Revenue investigator Owen Preece (guest star Robert Glenister) reveals John's business manager Mark Donovan has been running an alcohol scam through their haulage firm and the deceased had agreed to offer information in exchange for immunity from prosecution. Was his cover blown? Owen doesn't think so, and Mark has an alibi - unlike John's wife. Brenda Blethyn stars, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: In 1838, at the age of 18, young princess Alexandrina's life is transformed when she ascends the throne of Great Britain and becomes Queen Victoria. As monarch in her own right, the young Victoria suddenly finds herself freed of the repressive shackles placed on her by her mother's advisor, Conroy, and builds a new alliance with the charismatic prime minister Lord Melbourne. However, her inexperience makes her susceptible to mistakes - and ultimately scandal. Period drama, starring Jenna Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An archaeologist's wife is murdered during an excavation in the Middle East. Fortunately, a vacationing Poirot - who shares with most great detectives an inability to go on holiday without stumbling over a body or two - is on hand to investigate. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Ron Berglas, Georgina Sowerby and Iain Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Jane Preston and DS Ben Shaw are called to investigate the theft of £2,000 from an 80-year-old woman's home. Initially, suspicion falls on a possible rogue trader who visited the house to fix the roof, but a chance remark by the victim's flirtatious daughter Sylvia prompts the duo to wonder whether the culprit might be closer than they think. Drama, guest starring Deena Payne (Emmerdale), Stuart Organ (The Bill) and Kazia Pelka (Heartbeat).(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates a double poisoning, aiming to prove the innocence of Elinor Carlisle, the chief suspect in the deaths of her aunt and her rival in love. However, it emerges that she is the only person with a motive, opportunity and means to administer the poison. Crime drama, starring David Suchet, Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Diana Quick, Paul McGann and Rupert Penry-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: A gangland killing takes a surprising twist when it turns out the victim has been sexually mutilated. Andy punishes Janet by keeping her out of the heart of the investigation, and when she rebels, the ensuing row becomes personal. Rachel feels ambushed by Sean, who announces his mother wants to meet her - especially as she has spent years trying not to think about her own mum. Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Sean Maguire and Nicholas Gleaves star.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel discovers Nick has been brutally assaulted - and she is top of the list of suspects. But even worse, she has no recollection of the previous night after a drunken hen party, and struggles to convince herself she did not do it. Janet thinks she has made her peace with Andy, until he gives her some misinformation that results in Gill missing an appointment with the coroner - so the DCI, tired of their games, announces one of them will have to go. A man's accidental death turns into a murder investigation when his daughters reveal their mother often talked of killing him. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Family and friends attend the funeral of 11-year-old Rhys Jones is laid to rest, while a police raid at the home of Kevin Moody leads to the recovery of the gun used in the schoolboy's murder. Moody must choose between being labelled a grass and risking violent retribution or protecting the killer and facing jail time. But an unexpected result from the forensic tests on the firearm leaves the entire investigation hanging in the balance. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Graham and Michael Moran.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The rescue team saves a dog trapped underneath a house, the SPCA investigates the death of a horse and Maverick seeks justice for the death of two huskies.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Sherrill Levitt, Suzie Streeter and Stacy McCall who vanished from their home in Springfield, Missouri, in June 1992. Sherrill was Suzie's mother, while Stacy was her friend and the disappearance happened a day after Suzie and Stacy had graduated from high school.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: The criminals who few people would suspect, whose often shocking white collar crimes prove that a book should never be judged by its cover.(n)

programme.desc: Agents investigating the death of a New York petrol station mogul infiltrate the crime ring responsible and discover a Mafia world of brutality and murder.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Deadliest Lovers
programme.desc: How a once loving relationship turned sour when Kevin Nunn became increasingly controlling over girlfriend Dawn Walker. Jealousy and stalking ensued leading to a brutal murder.(n)

programme.title: Married with Secrets
programme.desc: A case in which LAPD investigators hunted a criminal behind the disappearance of expensive yachts. As inquiries proceeded, they found a mild-mannered man among their own ranks who was involved in a lot more than just boat theft.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators in Wisconsin try to unravel the mystery of a house fire that may have been deliberately set to destroy evidence of a more heinous crime. Plus, in Florida an arsonist is linked to a series of fatal fires.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Gathering evidence from ashes and rubble to help forensics teams apprehend the perpetrators in cases of arson.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-two Nikki Whitehead, who was killed in her own home. Police suspected she may have known her killer, resorting to polygraphs and CCTV footage to help reveal the horrific truth.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The case of 46-year-old Julie Williams, who died in April 1986 two days after drinking cyanide-laced water from an office cooler. Lewis Allen Harry, eventually convicted of her murder, had apparently been targeting his wife Sandra, who worked in the same establishment.(n)

programme.title: American Monster
programme.desc: The case of Max and Janeene Jones, who until his death appeared to have the perfect marriage. Suspicions were aroused about the nature of Max's demise, after Janeene was caught on camera trying to hire a hitman to kill her second husband, Matthew Smith, who she had a life insurance policy on.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Kathy Bonney, who was shot at close range and her body dumped in Virginia's Great Dismal Swamp in 1987. Her father, Tom Bonney, claimed he feared she would grow up to live a corrupt life, so carried out the murderous act while possessed by an alternate personality named `Hitman'.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a loving couple were gunned down and killed. A cryptic message found scrawled across the pair's bedroom wall led police to suspect the crime was drug related, though the victims had no obvious involvement in such an illegal trade.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old former cheerleader Amy Lord. CCTV footage from ATMs and outside her home captured the moment she was taken by her killer.(n)

programme.title: Murder Calls
programme.desc: The case of a priest stabbed to death and found by his parishioners. As part of their investigations, police discovered a harrowing emergency call made by the victim himself.(n)

programme.title: I Am Homicide
programme.desc: Detective Garry McFadden recalls being assigned to conduct what he thought will be a routine investigation of a man injured in a hit-and-run accident. After, the victim died, and McFadden discovered it had been a deliberate act.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: New series. The 1991 murder of New York fashion photographer Joel Schoenfeld, who was shot dead in his Greenwich Village studio. A dark secret and a tale of revenge emerged when it was claimed the Schoenfeld had raped the girlfriend of the man identified as the gunman.(n)

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Ronald Hawkins and Candace Sims talk about their 19-year-old son Robbie, who killed nine people including himself, in a mass shooting at a shopping centre in Omaha, Nebraska, in December 2007. They share their intimate insights and personal experiences from throughout Robbie's life, detailing everything from their past attempts to help him, to the day he committed a crime that shook America.(n)

programme.desc: Youth is no drawback to being a cold-hearted killer. As this documentary reveals, for some twisted young women, taking a life is merely child's play when homicide is concerned.(n)

programme.desc: Investigating the growing crime of letter-bombing in the USA, and exploring the techniques forensic lab technicians use to trace the perpetrators.(n)

programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigators raid a property that they suspect is being used to stage illegal dog fights.(n)

She died in a road traffic accident later the same night, but having no identification on her lay unclaimed at the San Bernardino County Coroner's Office until the link with her missing persons case was made 19 months later.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: Recounting how, in 1997, an armoured car driver for Loomis (formerly Loomis, Fargo & Co) led a team in a brazen heist stealing $17.3million from the Loomis vault.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: The drug dealer and cold-blooded murderer whose calling card was a grenade. Plus, a crime in which $5million in cash and jewels disappeared from an airline's vault.(n)
