programme.desc: Courtroom programme featuring prominent US legal commentator and former District Attorney and County Judge Jeanine Pirro as the presiding jurist.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A cult member betrays the leader to the FBI following the discovery of a decapitated young male, and is able to link him with dozens of other murders.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Deadliest Lovers
programme.desc: How financial problems pushed Stephen Barnsdale Quean's 10-year marriage to the limit, leading him to strangle wife Chantelle to death. At first, he claimed she had attacked him.(n)

programme.title: Married with Secrets
programme.desc: When Jean Claude Dominique fell victim to a hit-and-run, his wife rushed to his side - only to meet his other wife and learn the danger of his double life.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators assess conflicting accounts of an office party that took a violent turn and left one woman injured.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The case of a man who staged his wife's suicide in a bid to cash in on her life insurance policy, but was caught out by modern forensic technology.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 15-year-old Elizabeth Ennen, who was last seen when a friend dropped her home. Police uncovered a piece of CCTV that turned the case in an unexpected direction.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The murder of 29-year-old Cynthia Epps, whose stabbed body was found stuffed into a cabinet in June 1994. Her killer evaded capture for 18 years, but advances in DNA technology and dogged detective work eventually put James Fountain behind bars.(n)

programme.title: American Monster
programme.desc: The daughter of one of America's most notorious killers gives an exclusive interview, taking viewers on a journey into the eyes of a cold-blooded murderer.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Edith McLeroy, who rebelled against her conservative upbringing in Alabama by marrying the leader of a biker crew. Her tethered body was retrieved from marshes in 1980, but it took 30 years until the mystery of her death was resolved.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 34-year-old Susan Casey. The mother-of-four's body was found floating in the Yellowstone River in May 2008, but the autopsy report concluded that she had been strangled. The investigation went cold for a few years until her ex-husband Walter Larson was arrested.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: After dropping her two boys at school in Coral Springs, Florida, Surya Toha vanishes without a trace. Chilling CCTV footage reveals exactly what happened to her.(n)

programme.title: Gone
programme.desc: A haunted woman wages a valiant fight to rescue her daughter from a gang of kidnappers in this Lifetime Original Movie starring Molly Parker (Deadwood, The Road). The victim of a brutal assault that destroyed her marriage and threatened her future as a mother, Amy is devastated when her young daughter, Emily, is suddenly and mysteriously abducted. But when the kidnappers attempt to manipulate Amy into killing a patient in the hospital where she works in exchange for her daughter's safe return, the desperate mother boldly refuses. Now, as Amy searches desperately for clues to Emily's whereabouts, she gradually discovers that the malevolent plot leads directly to the most powerful people in her city. With the police and local politicians doing everything in their power to destroy her family, Amy must avoid succumbing to the emotional pain of her past trauma, and find her daughter so the conspiracy will be exposed and justice served(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Good Deeds
programme.desc: An upstanding businessman finds his upcoming marriage thrown into question when his connection with a down-on-her-luck cleaning woman turns unexpectedly romantic. Wesley Deeds (Tyler Perry) is a prominent businessman who has successfully taken the reins of the family business. He displays commendable patience while dealing with his insubordinate brother and strives to give his demanding fiancée, Natalie (Gabrielle Union), a happy, stable future. Up until now, Wesley's life has been comfortable, but the moment he meets Lindsey (Thandie Newton), everything starts to change. A proud single mother who has just gotten evicted and now struggles to give her daughter some much-needed stability, Lindsey never asked for a handout in her life. But when Wesley offers to lend the outspoken custodian the help that she needs to get her life back together, their friendly bond quickly develops into something much deeper. Now, with his heart and his head pulling in different directions, Wesley realizes that his entire future may not be as predictable as he once thought(n)

programme.desc: Ben Hillman comes to the aid of Ruth Jobey, who wants to leave her busy London life behind and work as a virtual PA from the relaxed town of Olivia on Spain's Costa Azahar.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Black Lion in Halland, East Sussex, where host Nigel Fright gets off to a shaky start when a kettle goes missing from one of the rooms. Later, he takes the guests to a salsa class, where Sherrill Tacy and Hayley Cotton are surprised by some of his dance moves.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Wheatsheaf Inn in Exning, near Newmarket, Suffolk, where guests are welcomed by owner Ken Clutterbuck and employee Ginny Trow. The proprietor tries to win his rivals round with his unique sense of humour, but tensions rise when the contestants go for a spin on a go-kart track.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sherrill Tacy hosts at the Sherwood Guest House in New Brighton on the Wirral, and is praised for the establishment's value for money. However, there is upset when her breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and her final review is far from perfect.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Final hosts Mark and Rachael Dann welcome the contestants to the Big Bear Lodge in Shropshire. They face the tough job of trying to keep the rift between some of the guests to a minimum in their ski-themed B&B, and their afternoon activity of canoeing raises a few laughs but accusations of cheating occur when the boys begin to get competitive.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Pia and Stephen Abbott have been married for 35 years and have long dreamt of owning a property in Spain. Jasmine Harman helps the couple find a home around La Marina Alta within their £130,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Elsa and Brian Surridge, who are looking for a retirement home on the Costa Blanca and have a cash budget of £75,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team explore a site at Brancaster in Norfolk that is believed to have been a Roman `shore fort', and possibly a key military outpost. They amass 2,500 finds - their biggest-ever haul - which provide information on contemporary decorative arts, sport and much more, and also undertake a high-definition geophysics survey that generates enough data to crash the computers. The biggest surprise reveals evidence of a high level of trade with the local population, and clues as to how Britons living near the site benefited financially from the Roman presence.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians help Hektor Rous, the son of `Aussie Earl' Keith Rous, piece together the mysterious history of the family's Tudor country home in Suffolk. In 2004, he moved from Melbourne, Australia, hoping to rebuild the estate's fortunes, and established events such as the Latitude Festival in its 3,500-acre grounds.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to West Sussex to rescue an iconic 1970s motor - and the first truly successful Japanese car export - the mighty Datsun 240z.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team fight to save the leg of a much-loved golden retriever, and a French bulldog with twisted elbows needs a doggy wheelchair and some challenging surgery. At Noel's Oncology & Soft Tissue Hospital in Guildford, a spaniel cross has a tumour removed by specialist Professor Nick Bacon.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel and his team face an emergency when a black Labrador is rushed in after being hit by a car. The pioneering vets also treat a cocker spaniel with a bulging disc in its spine and a basset hound that needs its leg straightening. But the dog is also overweight, so the professor insists it be put on a diet.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Tim and Philomena O'Donovan, who are trying to convert the old lifeboat station in Tenby, Pembrokeshire, into a contemporary home and preserve the historic building for posterity. A weather-worn, rusting and rotting hulk that was never designed for habitation, it is perched on a steel pier 40ft above the sea and can only be reached by crossing the sandy beach at low tide.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Peter Maddison meets Nick and Nicole New from Queensland, who have given an architect the job of creating a house that is sympathetic to the dense rainforest surrounding their land.(n)

programme.title: The Billion Pound Hotel
programme.desc: Shaped like a giant sail and standing more than 1,000ft tall, the Burj Al Arab in Dubai cost an estimated £1billion to build, and has been dubbed the world's most luxurious hotel. Guests paying anything up to £10,000 a night expect only the highest of standards, so what does it take for the staff to satisfy these demanding customers? This programme follows the stories of a variety of visitors, from the King of Uganda to a firefighter who has saved up months of wages, and the workers who serve them.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz. Guest captain Richard Ayoade is joined by Rob Beckett, going up against Jon Richardson and Claudia Winkleman, with Adam Riches accompanying Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley dishing out the all-important consonants, vowels and numbers.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Danny Dyer taking on Joe Wilkinson and Gabby Logan, while David O'Doherty joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by comedienne Jo Brand, musician Ronan Keating, journalist Krishnan Guru-Murthy and actor James Acaster to discuss and dissect the events that set the British public's chins wagging over the past week. Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show.(n)

programme.desc: Pia and Stephen Abbott have been married for 35 years and have long dreamt of owning a property in Spain. Jasmine Harman helps the couple find a home around La Marina Alta within their £130,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Golf House on the Isle of Wight, where hosts John and Sue Blakemore hope to impress their guests during their stay. Things start off positively with a well-received breakfast, but a suspicious stain in a toilet causes controversy among some of the competitors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to St John's Wood, north-west London, where Nick Tyrie and his friend Layla Amini welcome their guests to the New Inn Pub. One of the proprietors tries to win points by revealing her musical past, but John and Sue Blakemore feel their room is too impersonal, and are underwhelmed by the choices at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Bunkroom hostel in Chester, David Sharrock is determined to prove that hostelling is for everybody - even if his wife Victoria isn't convinced. It's bunkbeds and budget breakfasts for all, as his fellow hosts decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to John Graham's the B&B in Blackpool for the final visit of the week, and an afternoon of tenpin bowling brings out the guests' competitive sides. Later, there is more tension at the dinner table when the host is subjected to aggressive questioning by John and Sue Blakemore.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the guest house owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After years spent dedicated to their demanding careers in nursing and social work, Gillian and Paul Clarke from Stockport have decided it's time to start taking it a little easier and put themselves first. They've got their hearts set on a holiday home on Spain's Costa Calida where they can boogie their way to retirement. Jonnie Irwin shows the couple five properties for their budget of £45,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After becoming foster parents to three young children, Jo Danson and her husband Bill decided a holiday home would be the perfect way for everyone to spend quality time together. Working within a budget of £65,000, Jasmine Harman shows Jo five suitable properties in the Orihuela Costa region of Spain.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his team head to an army training ground on Salisbury Plain to discover what lies beneath the Barrow Clump, a huge mound of earth built by Bronze Age people to bury their dead. More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. The team is joined for the dig by a group of wounded soldiers whose members are being trained in archaeology as part of their rehabilitation.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Lake District to look for copper, a forgotten piece of the nation's industrial heritage. There are nearly two dozen old mines across the mountains, some thought to have been established 400 years ago when the valleys would have been studded with workshops, scaffolding and water-powered machines, home to a brave band of Tudor miners. The team battles the rain, wind and dangerously unstable trackways, but the combination of sheer effort and hi-tech kit enables the experts to access the heart of an old mine.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Croydon to restore a 1964 Volvo P1800, the vehicle synonymous with cult series The Saint, starring Roger Moore, who makes a special appearance.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: New series. Noel Fitzpatrick and his team return to provide more cutting-edge animal care. The professor's first patient is labradoodle Mitzi, who has been hit by a car - and Noel's biggest concern is that she may have suffered nerve damage, leaving her owners fearing the worst. Options are limited for 10-month-old German pointer Hector, who is struggling to walk - he must undergo spinal surgery or face the prospect of being put to sleep, while a Leonberger with a cancerous leg undergoes an operation to remove the tumour.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A champion running dog is admitted to see if Noel and the team can fix its abnormal elbow joint, and a couple have a nerve-racking wait while their Rhodesian ridgeback undergoes a high-risk operation to relieve the pressure on the nerves in its spine. Noel also treats an injured dog belonging to a friend from the gym.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Paul and Penny Denby, who are demolishing their mock-Georgian home on an exclusive south London estate to replace it with a contemporary mansion. The couple have little building experience and struggle with the dozens of design decisions they must make, and find themselves £250,000 short of the amount needed to finish the property.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire's healing abilities puts her at odds with the town priest after she saves the life of a boy, and deepens the suspicions against her. Period drama, starring Caitriona Balfe.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man arrives at Luton police station claiming his life is in danger and that he has just escaped from a slave-owning gang that held him captive at a travellers' site in a remote part of Bedfordshire. Cameras follow as a major operation is launched to investigate the allegations, with more than 200 officers drafted in for a dawn raid on the site to arrest their suspects.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Scaffolder Thomas arrives at London's King's College Hospital after suffering a head injury at a building site and doctors are concerned he may have fractured his skull, back or neck. Hilton, 85, has diabetes and is worried about his swollen legs, and retired architect Edgar is struggling to breathe following an asthma attack. Meanwhile, in the waiting room, two women make friends and swap stories and jokes.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Phoebe Hates PBS
programme.desc: The One Where Phoebe Hates PBS. To prove to Joey that she is capable of performing a good deed with no strings attached, Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) makes a large donation to PBS -- even though she has good reason to despise the network (it has something to do with Sesame Street never answering her letter). Chandler (Matthew Perry) overplays his hand when he overhears Monica (Courteney Cox) discussing her terrific "secret" boyfriend with Rachel (Jennifer Aniston). And Emily (Helen Baxendale) finally contacts her husband, Ross (David Schwimmer), begging him to move to London -- but what will Rachel say?(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Down the Drain. After a flash flood, drains clogged with human bones lead Catherine and Warrick underground, where they find themselves in a compromising situation; Greg donates his body fluids to science; and an untimely explosion jeopardizes the safety of the CSI team(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Crow's Feet. Catherine and Nick investigate the mysterious death of a woman who recently underwent cosmetic surgery after her body is discovered in a hotel suite; Grissom, Sara and Greg probe the suspicious death of a man who died in his house, apparently while it was being fumigated; Warrick confronts Catherine about the chemistry between them. Watson: David Anders. Malaga: Steven Brand. Ted: A.J. Buckley. Allen: Corey Mendell Parker. Beckman: David Wells(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Who Are You?. A murdered woman's skeleton is discovered in a cement slab underneath a house, and Grissom must figure out who she was and what happened to her. Also, Catherine's ex-husband is charged with raping a stripper; and a police officer is suspected of lying to investigators about his role in what was at first thought to be a suicide(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Formalities. Grissom and Catherine are at the Robert Cavallo's retirement dinner(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Snuff. Catherine investigates the grisly murder of a young woman in a snuff film, while Grissom probes the discovery of a body stuffed in a large toolbox and covered with fire ants. His initial findings indicate that the person died well over a year earlier and was possibly murdered. Sampson: William Mapother. Vane: Stephen Spacek. Johnson: Archie Kao. Teri: Pamela Gidley. Banson: Sam Hennings. Enrique: Sal Lopez. Traschel: Blair Williamson. Susan: Meredith Giangrande. Renatta: Niecy Nash(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Blood Lust. Grissom investigates the death of a 14-year-old boy who is pinned beneath the left rear tire of a taxi. The victim is eviscerated and has stab wounds and shows no marks of having been hit by the cab. After the apparent accident, the cabbie is pulled from his vehicle and beaten by a mob(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: No Humans Involved. Sara's mysterious background becomes a bit more clear as she helps investigate the starvation death of a 5-year-old boy whose body is discovered near a trash dumpster. At the county lock-up, Warrick and Nick probe the beating of a prisoner in an overcrowded cell. Later, Catherine learns that being the boss isn't all it's cracked up to be when she has to reprimand Warrick for what she deems unprofessional behavior(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

Petersen) and Catherine (Marg Helgenberger) end up at the trendy restaurant where the victim had worked as a chef. Suspecting Vandal is involved in some way, Professor Stein and Sara go undercover at a psychiatric hospital in a bid to get closer to their arch-enemy. Meanwhile, Ray and Kendra try to gain the locals' trust, but end up getting more than they bargained for. Superhero adventure, starring Caity Lotz and Brandon Routh.(n)

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: The FBI descends into a panic over a plot to cripple the American economy, and as the nation faces the prospect of total collapse, Red and Liz try to catch one of the most fearsome names on the blacklist. Meanwhile, Liz's hands are also full caring for a sick loved one. Drama, starring James Spader.(n)

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force and is responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.(n)

programme.title: Flintoff: Lord of the Fries
programme.desc: Andrew `Freddie' Flintoff reunites with cyclist Rob Penn to go on another set of adventures in their eco-friendly chip van. Their first stop is in the wilds of Northumberland, where a date with a thousand seals results in an unexpected kiss, while Rob sets off to climb what he claims is Britain's tallest tree and Freddie comes up with a unique - and rather dubious - culinary invention.(n)

programme.title: Colony
programme.desc: Will makes a risky call when he decides to trust an old friend in the Santa Monica bloc, while security agent Jennifer pays Katie a visit and Bram meets the camp commandant.(n)

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: The documentary returns to focus on policing in the north-east of England. Officers race to a stabbing outside a pub in Newcastle and there is a raid on a cannabis farm.(n)

programme.title: Strike Back
programme.desc: Stonebridge wakes to find he and Scott have been imprisoned alongside the hostages, and is summoned for a meeting with Hasani - who reveals his grisly plans. As one of the captives is led away to be executed, the two soldiers realise they must act swiftly to save everyone. Action drama, starring Philip Winchester and Sullivan Stapleton.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Craig Charles and Jayne Middlemiss present as the four remaining robots enter the arena to do battle in the Grand Final. Tornado enters the competition as reigning champion, but Storm II, X-Terminator and Typhoon 2 are all hoping to steal its crown.(n)

programme.title: Wild Vets
programme.desc: Documentary series following the challenging work of New Zealand's vets as they treat some of the most exotic animals in the country's zoos and wildlife parks.(n)

programme.title: Andromeda

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: Kara and her boss come under threat from a volatile CatCo employee who undergoes a major transformation. Plus, Kara's mother arrives for Thanksgiving.(n)

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: Dylan, Beka, Rev Bem and Tyr are pursued by a gang of Nietzscheans and get lost in an uncharted galaxy where they are forced to land on an inhospitable ice world.(n)

programme.title: Stargate SG-1
programme.desc: Daniel reunites with former comrade Chaka in a bid to reach a peaceful compromise as SG-3 prepares to do battle with the Unas over a Naquadah mine. Sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dean Anderson and Michael Shanks.(n)

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: The return after a mid-series break of the comic-book adventure about the 24-year-old cousin of Superman. Kara attempts to brush off Cat's allegations that she is Supergirl, while General Lane tortures Astra as he tries to discover Non's location.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Joe and Cisco head to Starling City to continue their investigation of Dr Harrison Wells, enlisting the help of Laurel and Quentin Lance. Back home, Barry is kept busy trying to catch Hannibal Bates, a mischievous meta who can adopt the physical identity of anyone he touches - even The Flash. Superhero adventure, with guest appearances from Stephen Amell, Paul Blackthorne and Katie Cassidy.(n)

programme.title: Arrow
programme.desc: Slade continues his vendetta against Oliver, breaking into the lair and sending one member of Team Arrow to the hospital - and then things get really personal when he turns his attention to Thea. Backed into a corner, the bow-wielding hero is forced to choose between the fight for the greater good and protecting his loved ones. Laurel, on the other hand, grapples with a new secret.(n)

programme.title: DC's Legends of Tomorrow
programme.desc: Ray, Sara and Kendra find themselves stranded in the 1950s and decide it is time to move on with their lives after waiting months for their colleagues and Waverider to return. Ray and Kendra grow closer, but Sara makes an unexpected decision when she returns to Ra's al Ghul and the League of Assassins.(n)

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Part one of two. News of Red's systematic manhunt prompts Anslo Garrick, a man whose name is on the blacklist, to try to infiltrate the FBI to capture the ex-con. Meanwhile, Ressler is ordered to guard the informant when Liz goes missing. Crime drama, guest starring Ritchie Coster, with James Spader.(n)

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force and is responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As Chief Justice Ashland's health problems mount, his former clerk Joe Quincy is pressed into service to persuade him to retire. CJ prepares Zoey for a briefing about her kidnapping, Abbey reveals an uncomfortable truth about her marriage, and President Bartlet refuses to be bullied by the Republicans over budget negotiations. Matthew Perry guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet and the powerful Republican Speaker of the House disagree over the budget, leading to a crisis when the federal government is shut down. Leo, Josh and Toby send White House staff home, but the trio are uneasy as the President refuses to compromise - until Josh hatches a bold plan to challenge the opposing party. Meanwhile, Abbey reappears from her self-imposed exile for a state dinner that she might have to cook herself. Gary Cole guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A 14-year-old musical prodigy disappears on the night of a concert, taking her valuable violin with her. Meanwhile, Samantha tries to recover from her gunshot wound, but makes slow progress. Anthony LaPaglia stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nuns are horrified to find a woman crucified in a church, and subsequent investigations suggest she was sleeping with the popular new parish priest - leading Grissom to suspect their forbidden affair could have led him to kill her. Forensic drama, starring William Petersen, Jorja Fox and Marg Helgenberger.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny becomes the target of a drug cartel after he intercepts a cash shipment, and Mayor Poole confides in Frank that he plans to retire. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet's Christmas preparations at the White House are overshadowed by the news that aid workers have been kidnapped in the Sudan. A reunion with his three daughters proves bittersweet when he learns his son-in-law wants to run for Congress, and Toby clashes with Will over keeping the President out of a debate on assisted suicide.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet attends the funeral of a former president, along with two of his predecessors. The flight out offers them the chance to chew over their mistakes, and ponder their impact on the current crises facing the nation. Leo learns his ex-wife is to remarry, CJ investigates disturbing scientific experiments and Josh gets caught in the middle of a heated debate. John Goodman and James Cromwell guest star.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team search for a missing woman whose description is similar to that of several murder victims from a 12-year-old case. Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom takes a dangerous gamble by enlisting the help of a paedophile in an effort to find two missing 10-year-old boys. Suspicion falls on the father of one of the youngsters, but the plot thickens with the discovery that he and the other child's grandfather are sworn enemies. Drama, starring William Petersen and Marg Helgenberger.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: New York City police commissioner Frank Reagan finds himself dealing with the fallout of an accidental shooting. Meanwhile, a dangerous criminal from Danny's past returns to the city and kidnaps Jackie. Drama, guest starring Michael Madsen, with Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.desc: Sue Perkins is joined by Al Murray, Lauren Laverne and Jonathan Ross to discuss the seventh season of Game of Thrones.(n)

programme.title: Seven Days in Hell
programme.desc: Spoof documentary starring Kit Harington and Andy Samberg, recounting an epic clash between rival tennis players that lasted a week. Also starring Will Forte.(n)

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Paulie and Christopher argue bitterly and Junior undergoes surgery for stomach cancer, but his nephew advises him to seek a second opinion when his doctor tells him he might need to go under the knife again. Meanwhile, Carmela visits a therapist due to her guilt about her husband's criminal activity, but is surprised by the uncompromising advice she receives.(n)

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tony's generosity in giving up his time with Dr Melfi pays off - but his feud with Ralph reaches breaking point. Meanwhile, Meadow and Jackie Jnr find they have more in common than they thought. Crime drama, starring James Gandolfini.(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie
programme.desc: Frank worries about the future of his relationship with Jackie after witnessing a fight between her and Kevin and encourages she work on her issues. Meanwhile, matters between Jackie and Grace deteriorate as the teenager continues to lie about seeing her older boyfriend Danny and the cause of Mrs Akalitus's memory loss is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie

programme.title: Nurse Jackie

Grace, meanwhile, refuses to go to the ceremony, but Zoey won't let her off the hook that easily. At the hospital, Thor bonds with an elderly gay man who is admitted with advanced liver cancer and Carrie is left fighting for her job when she is subjected to a peer review. Comedy drama, starring Edie Falco and Merritt Wever.(n)

programme.title: Storm City

programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of London's most famous markets. programme.desc: On a slow news day, Josh and the president devise a plan to rescue Toby's deal from certain disaster after a persistent reporter fishes for a scoop. programme.desc: The team searches for a missing teenage boy and it transpires that the youth had a faltering relationship with his girlfriend - could this hold the key to his whereabouts? Drama series, starring Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.desc: An elderly cancer patient is murdered, and later proves to have been another victim of the miniatures killer. programme.desc: A woman withdraws her claims of domestic violence and Danny and Jackie's investigation into her motives reveals she is having an affair with a high-powered city councilman - who also happens to be a friend of Frank's. programme.title: Son of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Comedy sequel which sees Inspector Clouseau's over-enthusiastic son on the trail of a kidnapped princess, proving to be just as inept as his father every step of the way. Starring Roberto Benigni, Herbert Lom, Claudia Cardinale, Burt Kwouk, Debrah Farentino and Graham Stark.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Tom Holland as the friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man, taking on Michael Keaton's Vulture with the help of Iron Man.(n)

programme.title: Drillbit Taylor
programme.desc: Three kids fall foul of the local bully on their first day at high school, so they advertise for a bodyguard. They end up hiring a man who turns out to be a low-rent mercenary, but discover their new-found protector is not quite the hardened soldier of fortune he claims to be. Comedy, starring Owen Wilson, Leslie Mann, Nate Hartley and Troy Gentile.(n)

programme.title: Date and Switch
programme.desc: Premiere. Two guys make a pact to lose their virginity before their senior prom, but things take an unexpected turn when one of them comes out of the closet. Comedy, starring Nicholas Braun, Hunter Cope and Dakota Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Meatballs
programme.desc: A summer camp leader's trainee staff drive him up the wall with their endless mischief-making, prompting him to knock them all into shape for an imminent sporting contest. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Harvey Atkin, Kate Lynch and Russ Banham.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Working Girl
programme.desc: Naive but ambitious secretary Tess discovers her conniving boss has been claiming credit for her ideas. She hatches a plan to get revenge and further her own career into the bargain, with a little help from the unscrupulous executive's boyfriend. Comedy, starring Melanie Griffith, Sigourney Weaver, Harrison Ford, Joan Cusack and Alec Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A journalist lives her life by her father's maxim that monogamy never works, and has spent her adult life enjoying freedom from commitment. When she is sent to interview a doctor, an attraction develops between them, and she begins to wonder if there mighty be something to be said for a stable relationship. Comedy, starring Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, Brie Larson and Tilda Swinton.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Gremlins
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.(n)

programme.title: Jackass Number Two
programme.desc: Another batch of outrageous stunts is lined up by the death-defying friends, who get chased by bulls, used as human shark bait, have leeches attached to their eyes and ride a giant rocket. Comedy sequel, starring Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Steve-O, Chris Pontius and Ryan Dunn.(n)

programme.title: The Curse of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau vanishes without trace and another detective must be chosen to solve the mystery of his disappearance. Glad to be rid of the bane of his existence, Clouseau's long-suffering boss makes sure an even more inept investigator gets the job. Comedy, starring Herbert Lom, Ted Wass, Joanna Lumley, David Niven and Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: A Playboy bunny is ejected from Hugh Hefner's mansion for being considered over-the-hill on her 27th birthday, and has to find a new home and a fresh role in life. She becomes the unlikely house mother for a dowdy college sorority, and sets about giving its inmates a pin-up style makeover and turning their social lives around. Comedy, starring Anna Faris, Colin Hanks, Emma Stone and Kat Dennings.(n)

programme.title: Me Him Her
programme.desc: A man travels to Los Angeles on a mission to help his gay best friend, the star of a popular TV show, to come out. The actor's revelation is accelerated when he meets the man of his dreams, but he needs help to cope with media scrutiny - however, his friend has problems of his own, as he starts a romance with a woman whose ex is insanely jealous. Comedy, starring Luke Bracey, Dustin Milligan, Emily Meade and Geena Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear
programme.desc: Blundering cop Frank Drebin discovers a secret conspiracy to kidnap a renowned solar energy expert and replace him with an imposter. As he sets out to bring the perpetrators to justice, he is unexpectedly reunited with an old flame. Slapstick comedy sequel, starring Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy, Richard Griffiths and OJ Simpson.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent Gracie Hart is taken off active duty and made the face of the bureau's publicity campaign, but would rather catch crooks than be the focus of media attention - so when her friends are kidnapped, she disobeys orders to run her own undercover investigation with the help of a short-tempered colleague. Comedy sequel, starring Sandra Bullock, Regina King, William Shatner and Heather Burns.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent Gracie Hart is taken off active duty and made the face of the bureau's publicity campaign, but would rather catch crooks than be the focus of media attention - so when her friends are kidnapped, she disobeys orders to run her own undercover investigation with the help of a short-tempered colleague. Comedy sequel, starring Sandra Bullock, Regina King, William Shatner and Heather Burns.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Family man Rusty Griswold spent his childhood family holidays stumbling from one disaster to another with his hapless father. He is determined that his own road trip with his wife and kids will go better - but soon finds the apple has not fallen far from the tree. Sequel to the 1980s comedy series, starring Ed Helms and Christina Applegate, with Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo reprising their roles.(n)

programme.title: The Gnome-Mobile
programme.desc: An eccentric millionaire, along with his niece and nephew, finds two gnomes whose homes have been destroyed. They decide to help them find the rest of the tribe, but the family's friends think the tiny creatures are a figment of their imagination. Children's fantasy, starring Walter Brennan, Matthew Garber and Karen Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin and the King of Thieves
programme.desc: The Arabian adventurer prepares to marry his beloved Jasmine, but gets distracted by a gang of robbers who have stolen a powerful magical artefact, as well as the news that his long-lost father is still alive. Animated adventure sequel, with the voice of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger, Linda Larkin and John Rhys-Davies.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: Sanjay's Super Team
programme.desc: Bored with his father's meditation, a young Indian boy daydreams of Hindu gods as superheroes. Animated short, with the voices of Brent Schraff, Sunny Singh Attar, Arun Rao and Jaquelynn Herrera.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck barman is having a hard time coping after his wife leaves him and he loses his teaching job. His fortunes turn around when the American football team he has supported all his life holds open trials and, against all odds, he wins a place on the squad. Fact-based sporting drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: My Favorite Martian
programme.desc: A TV journalist meets a stranded alien who is trying to repair his crashed spacecraft. After first planning to exploit the chance of a big story, he instead offers his help after befriending the visitor - but a fellow reporter plans to expose the truth. Sci-fi comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Christopher Lloyd, Jeff Daniels, Elizabeth Hurley and Daryl Hannah.(n)

programme.title: In Search of the Castaways
programme.desc: The two children of a missing sea captain receive a message in a bottle that convinces them their father is still alive. Enlisting an eccentric French professor to help them find him, they embark on round-the-world journey and face natural disasters and mutineers during the voyage. Children's adventure based on a novel by Jules Verne, starring Maurice Chevalier, Hayley Mills and George Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Hound 2
programme.desc: Sequel to the Disney animation, in which Copper the dog joins a country music band of strays. However, his taste of fame leads him to neglect old friend Tod the fox. With the voices of Patrick Swayze, Reba McEntire, Harrison Fahn and Jonah Bobo.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: A Bug's Life
programme.desc: Well-meaning ant Flik lands his colony in trouble when he accidentally disposes of an offering meant for a swarm of greedy grasshoppers - who promptly promise a horrible revenge. Faced with the imminent destruction of the anthill, he sets out to save the situation by enlisting the help of a few would-be heroes - an out-of-work troupe of bugs from a low-rent flea circus. Pixar animation, with the voices of Dave Foley, Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: The Love Bug
programme.desc: Herbie, an irrepressible Beetle car with a mind of its own, takes a shine to a struggling racing driver and leads him to victory on the track. However, his success attracts the attention of an unscrupulous rival competitor, who will go to any lengths to win the most important race of all. Disney comedy, starring Dean Jones, Michele Lee, Buddy Hackett and David Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: A Bug's Life
programme.desc: Well-meaning ant Flik lands his colony in trouble when he accidentally disposes of an offering meant for a swarm of greedy grasshoppers - who promptly promise a horrible revenge. Faced with the imminent destruction of the anthill, he sets out to save the situation by enlisting the help of a few would-be heroes - an out-of-work troupe of bugs from a low-rent flea circus. Pixar animation, with the voices of Dave Foley, Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)
